reviewText: There is too much to say about this movie. It is so over the top that when the movie is done, you forget just how much crazy crap these guys get in to. Definitely go see it if you love movies like old school, role models etc. I don't think there is going to be a funnier movie this year.

Doug, Phil, Stu and Alan are four friends who go to Vegas to have a wild bachelor party before Doug's impending wedding. The guys get drugged with roofies and are unable to remember the details of their drunken night of debauchery. But Doug is missing and there's a tiger in the bathroom. The bulk of the movie is about the guys getting involved in all sorts of crazy predicaments while searching for the missing groom to be.

This is your typical Hollywood comedy with stereotypical characters, impossible situations and gross out gags. In other words if you are looking for an intelligent or thought provoking movie this is not the one. But if you only want a few mindless laughs on a lazy afternoon then it's an OK choice. Certainly not the best comedy of the year but not the worst either.

The Hangover is one of the best comedies I've seen in a long time. It's very raunchy as expected and earns an R rating many times over, but it doesn't get quite as extreme as I thought it would. There is something about letting loose in a packed theater when a movie is truly funny and everyone is having a great time. I'm so glad I listened to the critic's positive reviews on this movie and avoided seeing Land of the Lost, which they are bashing the life out of. The casting of the three main guys is excellent, giving everyone a chance to shine as the film unfolds. Zach Galifianakis (what a last name!) is the real star of the show here, mixing a creepy and weird vibe with some great line delivery. He creates a very memorable character.

The only minor complaint I have is that the trailers should have not given away so much, like with the Mike Tyson scene. I had probably seen that part at least two dozen times before on TV, so it barely got a laugh out of me this time around.

There are just so many clever gags and I don't want to spoil them for you, but make sure you stay when the end credits start to roll. Some pictures are shown that explain more of the mystery and are worthy of some big laughs as well.

I was a little hesitant to see this movie, it seemed like one of the all too recent movies where all of the good parts are featured in the trailer, and that's all you've got.  So not the case.  Not only was it a packed theatre at the midnight showing, but there was not any interval longer than three minutes that had a quiet audience.  Nobody could stop laughing!
From Zach Galifiakanis, we had a stellar show.  His ability to play the creepy weirdo is out of this world.  His wolf pack speech was amazing.
The cameo from Mike Tyson was hilarious!
Don't miss the end credits where a lot of the missing information is revealed.

I expected this to be a cross between "Dude, where's my car" and "Bachelor Party."  Not surprisingly I was right.  What did surprise me was how good and funny this movie was.  From the moment the three friends wake up in the destroyed $4200 a night Caesar's Palace room the movie is mostly non stop laughs for an hour and a half.  It does peak about 2/3rds of the way through with a surprise locked in the trunk of classic Mercedes and loses just a bit of steam after that.  The end credits bring the laughs back though.  I highly recommend this to anyone over the age of 18 but I have to warn any parents out there that this movie IMO is not suitable for anyone under that age.  This is a very funny movie but it is also a very R rated movie.

Continuing the "Old School" tradition of adult comedies with immature humor, The Hangover succeeds with a promising premise and several inspired performances from its leads. While the plot's creativity does diminish at about the halfway mark and comparisons to lesser films of the genre become more apparent, the R-rated laughs and hilariously despicable misadventures of our gang of inebriated antiheroes maintains a consistent pairing of riotous vulgarities and comical camaraderie in desperation.

Before Doug's (Justin Bartha) wedding, his best friends Phil (Bradley Cooper) and Stu (Ed Helms), along with the groom's soon-to-be brother-in-law Alan (Zach Galifianakis), plan a wild bachelor party in Las Vegas. Upon awakening the next morning, Doug is missing and no one can seem to remember the events that transpired the night before. An abandoned baby, a missing tooth, a hospital tag, and a live tiger in the bathroom are just a few of the clues the hungover group of misfits must follow to find their friend and return home before the big day.

The Hangover is off to a good start when the major players immediately express their mismatched personalities and generally dysfunctional problem-solving attitudes. Shaft and semen jokes within the first 10 minutes, an eye-flinching jockstrap flash and questionable social mindsets also add to the roseate chaos to come. Although the story isn't entirely original, the premise is a nearly perfect setup for a comedy, and it's fitting that the rating doesn't hinder the outrageous levels of grossly immature and chiefly adult humor. Too bad the title "What Happens in Vegas" was already taken by a softy romantic chick-flick.

The film has a suitable mix of serious predicaments tied into the crude gags, brutal slapstick, the completely unexpected, hilariously coarse language and (no longer) limits-pushing nudity (unfortunately mostly male). This better balances the pacing of the film and grounds it in reality a little more convincingly, even though it appears to exaggerate out-of-control bachelor party scenarios - director Todd Phillips is convinced that there are real party stories out there that would make any element of The Hangover pale in comparison. With a barbarous stun gun demonstration, a stolen police car, a misplaced tiger, an unclaimed baby, Asian mobsters, Rain Man-gambling, and an unplanned marriage, the film is like Harold and Kumar on ecstasy and Saving Private Ryan in Vegas. It may not be the most groundbreaking comedy, but following the drunken leads' exploits in reverse is a formula for a great time.

- The Massie Twins

The Hangover describes the story of 3 men (Phil, Stu, and Alan) who experience an unforgettable night in Las Vegas as they celebrate their friend's upcoming wedding (Doug).  The trio wake up the next day so hammered that they don't recall what happened and have to piece together the events of the night before as Doug has gone missing.

I won't spoil the rest of the story, but the story involves a tiger, a baby, a stripper named Jade (played by the lovely Heather Graham), and an appearance by Mike Tyson.

Although, the second and third parts of this trilogy fail to deliver, the original version should prove to be a timeless classic.

Following my engagement, I bought my husband to be a collection of wedding themed movies. In the years we were dating, we went to the movies on an almost weekly basis. Leading up the wedding, movies got pushed aside to save money and save time planning.

The Hangover is a lighthearted, sarcastic film about a group of guys partying it up before one of their weddings. This is the original film in a three part series. My husband and I have seen all of these movies together in theaters so I had to buy the DVDs for our collection. This was a great film to put on to get excited for our own wedding and bachelor/bachelorette festivities. It is laugh out loud funny. This was a great movie to put on to relax and know that our wedding could never be a disaster like the Hangover. My husband and I can relate to this style of sarcastic humor. It may seem brash, or crude, but you can't please everyone.

My opinion is 100% my own - good or bad. I hope you found this review helpful. If so, I'd appreciate you clicking the "helpful" button!

I'll be honest, I wasn't terribly interested in seeing "The Hangover", but a friend of mine was persistent. I was wrong; this is a great movie, and is without question the best cautionary tale for potential grooms ever filmed. In short, a group of friends heads to Vegas for a bachelor party. In the process the groom gets lost and everyone has to try to figure out just what happened as memories due to excess alcohol and inadvertent drug ingestion have rendered the guys quite unable to recall anything. I was particularly fond of Ed Helms' terrific performance: his losing a tooth is one of the best scenes in a film filled with amazing visuals. Other highlights for me included the subplot about Mike Tyson's tiger (Mike does a great job here), and the scene where the groomsmen are interrogated in the Las Vegas police station for stealing a police car ("Not up in here!") and the subsequent Taser encounter.

"The Hangover" is too intricate to explain, and I wouldn't want to spoil it anyway; think of it conceptually as a particularly tawdry episode of "Seinfeld" where the entire cast has taken LSD, only a bit less lucid. Like "Seinfeld" at its best all the very disparate plot threads eventually come back together at the end, but you'll be wondering how until the very last second. This is a very colorful comedy, and was skillfully written, directed, and acted.

Crass, surprisingly un-hip (upon second viewing) and at times hilarious. The Hangover was at first another raunch-fest comedy - this time aimed at adults -- and then become a phenomenon. Watching the film, and not the phenomenon I was struck with how many of the jokes fall flat the second time, although its funniest moments are still very, very funny. Mike Tyson with his pet Tiger is inspired, as is Ken Jeong as a somewhat undefined Asian Gangster. I was thinking in the first frame that Zach Galifianakis would steal the show, but he really doesn't. I think Ed Helms does, as the Dentist who thinks of himself as being a doctor, but who is constantly reminded he is not. Bradley Cooper can do comedy, I think, but doesn't show it here. In fact, he isn't even a particularly good straight man, the way, for example, Jason Bateman is in Horrible Bosses. I gave it four stars because the first time I saw it in a theater, I laughed out loud, and was shocked to see Zach's penis in the closing 'out-takes.' This time it was just creepy. Sorry...

By Andy McKinney
The Hangover

 An R rated comedy can be a chancy proposition.  There is a tendency to go to the edge of propriety and well beyond as recent examples show us.  It is not so with this very funny, very much R movie.  The bizarre situations rather than gross out foulness provide the laughs.  The movie is set in Las Vegas, sin city as we all know, so the humor revolves around what most would call loose behavior.
 The story is a kind of cross between Dude Wheres My Car and Fear and Loathing In Las Vegas.  Four friends go to Vegas from LA to throw a bachelor party for one of them who is getting married in a couple of days.  This is a good premise for a comedy.  The twist is that it turns into a hilarious mystery.  Three of the friends wake up in a demolished hotel suite with no memory of the nights events.  They must patch together the evening from various clues.
 Clue #1, the groom is missing.  One of the guys, a dentist is missing a tooth.  There is a tiger in the bathroom and a baby in a closet.  The parking valet brings them their car, which has morphed from the antique Mercedes convertible with which they started the evening into a stolen police cruiser.  The cast makes this work in an absurdly believable way.
 Director Todd Phillips is responsible for a half dozen recent comedies, some featuring big stars.  This is his vehicle.  None of the actors is on the A list, or any list at all.  They will be after this very funny flick.  The Hangover will dwarf any of Mr. Phillips other movies in box office impact.

This very popular movie is just not my taste. I watched it because a friend wanted me to see it. Tiresome, predictable and sophomoric.

The values of this movie are what every young American man yearns for: reckless behavior with no consequences. Everything works out in the end for our heroes. But only in Hollywood. Trashed hotel rooms, abused children and animals, random bullets flying, senseless car crashes, police portrayed as clueless idiots, and women treated like property. What's not to like?

Of course there will be uncountable sequels.

The Hangover is the first movie of the The Hangover franchise and a comedy about three people - Phil Wenneck, Stu Price and Alan Garner - all of whom travel to Las Vegas to celebrate their friend Doug Billings' bachelor party. However,the party turns out to be race against time when the three groomsmen awaken after a night of heavy drinking to find out that their friend Doug has gone missing and they must find the groom to get him into the altar just in time for his wedding. Things become extremely difficult as all three have no recollection whatsoever of the the events that happened the night before.

No question that this is one comedic film that many people have wished for. It is definitely extremely funny as it presents brilliant humor. The viewer will probably have tears laughing while watching it. One reason for it is the fact that it has a clever script and the chemistry and exchange of dialogues between the major characters was definitely great. One will definitely have a great time watching it.

All that's missing is a baby.  No, just kidding.  This film does just fine without that.  Yes, there is a baby, but that's only a brief part of the overall mayhem and hilarity.  I will be honest...when I first heard about this film and saw it's trailers, I suspected it might be one of those slapstick comedies of which we've all seen a dime a dozen.  But no, everyone put in that extra effort and as a result, The Hangover was something more.  I did find the two cops in the interrogation scene a bit over the top (the cops from "Horrible Bosses" might have been the better choice), but I'll let that go..this film is too good for me to go and be petty.  After all, I'm naming it my second favorite film of all time.  Of course, this film's success can be largely attributed to its three leading men.  Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms, and Zach Galifianakis display a chemistry that properly develops throughout the film so the trio grows closer as we simultaneously come to sympathize more and more with their plight.  Ken Jeong is the wild card that every comedy surely wishes for and his unpredictability as an actor and in his character's role makes him the perfect foil for the three leads.  I have been a fan of Justin Bartha's since the first National Treasure film and feel that his talents were underused in this feature.  But I suppose that someone had to be missing for this plot to work...maybe the producers should have used someone less talented.  Then again, Mr. Bartha delivered such a strong performance in his brief time on the screen that it perhaps strengthened his friends' quest to find him as an audience would surely want for his safe return at the same time as any of the characters.  Someone else who didn't see nearly enough screen time was the waiting bride Tracy, played by Sasha Barrese.  They ought to have had her go out to Vegas to lead in the search for the missing groom.  But having a level-headed, take-charge person in this search party would have probably sped things up by a lot and ruined pretty much all comedic aspects of the plot.  So ultimately, it is good that the producers don't listen to me as this film would otherwise be very dull.  Instead, it is my favorite comedy of all time and my second favorite movie of all time.  Watch it and you'll see why and perhaps give it similar rankings on your own lists...if you're as geeky as myself and actually have those lists.  Enjoy.

i figured i would weigh in on this movie ...since im 52 now and really don't see hardly ANY newer movies.  im not a classics freak either.  so lets get on w/ it.  1st off...this movie has nothing to do w/ reality.  also...i know young teens who are EXACTLY like this.  sounds confusing huh?  its about as real as you can get in some ways. crude to extreme...(i mean watchin a full grown man helping a 6 month old infant to masterbate at the table is FUNNY !  sorry....i know this pisses people off but i had to wash my pants after this movie the 2nd time coz i finally got it.  its really probably not a good idea to show a 6 month old masterbating at the table....but....thats what makes it so funny.  also watching these idiots discover the tiger waking up in the car as they finally agree that haleys comet was not coming back for a while is another pair of my pants soiled. this is....without a doubt... the funniest movie i have ever seen.and  i have seen really funny movies. its both slapstick and conceptual....if you re a bible thumper....throw a few hail marys half way thru and you outta make it to confession with minimal guilt. jesus h christ this is a funny movie.

One of the funniest movies to come along in years. Just as "There's Something About Mary" blew away the competition in the 1990s, I believe "the Hangover" will be destined to be the classic movie of the 2000's. Yes, it's raunchy and not for the kiddies, but like all the great comedies, it's never mean toward its characters. You know it's a good comedy when even I laugh at the un-PC Asian character...the good natured fun of the movie overrides any possible offensiveness.
Any time a movie becomes a franchise it will wear out its welcome, but the first Hangover was definitely a great comedy.

I should be upfront and say I do not think I am the intended demographic for a movie like this. I had to give up alcohol and other controlled substances before I ever reached the blackout Vegas party stage of my life. I have never woken up in a motel room unable to remember what I did the night before. That does not mean I am incapable of appreciating some of the humor in this movie. There were genuinely funny moments in the film. I gave the film three stars for reasons I will elaborate on in a moment but, I will say, if you are among the target audience for this movie, or you are just looking for a wild and raunchy comedy, I feel quite certain you will enjoy this film, and will consider it worthy of at least four stars. So, I like to begin with the positive. I really like the way the movie was structured. Rather than just a linear chronicle of the night's events we see the characters wake up in the morning and they have to try to piece together what happened the night before while searching for their friend. I enjoyed that structure as each reveal became crazier than the last. I am not sure all the explanations made that much sense (how did they get the cop car? how did they get into Mike Tyson's house? why was Mr. Chow naked?, and the chicken was never explained) but you cannot demand too much realism from a movie like this. In terms of acting I am definitely a fan of Zach Galifianakis. He is an exceptional comic actor (as well as standup comedian). Zach's character Alan was, for me, the most consistently funny of the group. The other actors are all excellent actors as well, of course. Now, for the things I did not like about the movie. I was not overly thrilled with the characters. Phil did not seem like a very likable character to me. Perhaps he was not supposed to be. I feel like the movie walked sort of a middle path. They could have gone all the way with it and made the characters genuinely unlikable. Then it would have been fun to watch them get their comeuppance. There are two recent, brilliant, television shows that have followed that route: It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia: Seasons 1 & 2 , and Arrested Development: Seasons 1-3. On the other hand, they could have made the characters likable and had all their woes be the result of circumstance. This movie did not seem to me to choose either option. The characters were not all that likable or unlikable. I think I would have preferred if they had gone one way or the other. I think it also stretched believability a bit to think that the four main characters would be friends with each other in real life. They seemed to have very little in common. I realize you need contrast. You need the guy who is pushing everyone along to have a crazy time (Phil) and the person who is constantly worrying about his girlfriend back home (Stu). It just is hard for me to imagine that Stu and Phil would really be friends in real life. It is hard to imagine Alan being friends with anyone but they explained his presence fairly well in the beginning of the movie. I also feel like the overly domineering girlfriend (Melissa) is sort of a well worn trope by now. In terms of humor, I actually thought the funniest moments were a result of Alan's stupidity. A lot of the humor of the movie was simply a result of the inherent humor of male nudity. There is the early scene where Alan is in a jock strap, there is the doctor's visit with the old man who has to drop his pants, and there is Mr. Chow who, for some inexplicable reason, is naked when he jumps out of the trunk. That is sort of the same gag over and over and it seems a little repetitive. I am also not sure it is all that funny to begin with. I was certainly smiling through most of the movie but I rarely laughed out loud. Perhaps my expectations were a bit too high. I waited a long time to finally watch this: after it had become a virtual franchise and achieved its reputation as the highest grossing R-rated comedy ever. So, perhaps I was expecting too much. I do not feel like the movie really lived up to my expectations in the humor department. Still, the movie was entertaining. Even when I was not laughing I was enjoying the ride. So, the movie is worth watching. I have no regrets.

"The Hangover" is great! This is how the story goes: Two days before his wedding, Doug and his three friends drive to Las Vegas for a blow-out bachelor party they'll never forget. But, in fact, when the three groomsmen wake up the next morning, they can't remember a thing. For some reason, they find a tiger in the bathroom and a six-month-old baby in the closet of their suite at Caesars Palace. The one thing they can't find is Doug. With no clue as to what transpired and little time to spare, the trio must retrace their hazy steps and all their bad decisions in order to figure out where things went wrong and hopefully get Doug back to L.A. in time to walk down the aisle.

The cast led by Bradley Cooper (as Phil), Ed Helms (as Stu), Zach Galifianakis (as Alan) & Justin Bartha (as Doug) is great! The directing by Todd Phillips (also produced) (who also directed "Road Trip" (2000), "Old School" (2003) & "Starsky & Hutch" (2004) is great! The story & screenplay by Jon Lucas & Scott Moore (both who also wrote the screenplay to "Four Christmases" (2008) & "Ghosts Of Girlfriends Past" (2009, also wrote the story) is great!

The music by Christophe Beck (who also did the music to the upcoming "All About Steve" (2009, which also co-stars Cooper), "Post Grad" (2009) & "I Love You, Beth Cooper" (2009) is great! The cinematography by Lawrence Sher (who also did the cinematography to "I Love You, Man" (2009) is great! The film editing by Debra Neil-Fisher (who also did the film editing to "Baby Mama" (2008) is great! The production design by Bill Brzeski (who also did the production design to "The Forbidden Kingdom" (2008) is great! The art direction by Andrew Max Cahn (who also did the art direction to "He's Just Not That Into You" (2009, which also co-starred Cooper) (supervising art director) & A. Todd Holland (who also did the art direction to "The Kingdom" (2007) is great! The set decoration by Danielle Berman (who also did the set decoration to the upcoming "Pinkville" (2011) is great! The costume design by Louise Mingenbach (who also did the costume design to "X-Men" (2000), "X2" (2003) & "X-Men Origins: Wolverine" (2009) is great!

The Hangover is one of the best movies I have ever seen. It is a hilarious movie about four grown men having a bachelor party in Las Vegas, but when their friend goes missing they plan a mission to find them, but the only problem is they don't remember anything about that night. They go around Las Vegas as they unravel their crazy night.
I recommend this movie to  14 and up any kids younger it might be to inappropriate.

I heard about this movie for about a year from my co-workers. After buying it on DVD and watching it about 20 times I had to buy the Blu-ray. This movie is one of the funniest and most realistic and perfect Vegas vacation movies I've seen. We want to go to Vegas and recreate the movie.

I am not a fan of most predictable comedy (I don't like most Jim Carey comedy or Will Farrel for example).  I like the unexpected.  It's not your typical "O gosh he's going to do that and it's going to be hilarious!".  All of the funny parts are not advertised like in most comedy trailers.  You do not expect the things to happen that do happen.

****SPOILER ALERT****
For example- who would expect that when they go to open the trunk that a naked Chinese man would jump out!?

Finally saw the hangover (I know...a few years after the fact). It was funny but not quite as funny as it was purported to be. Nevertheless it was good enough for the 2.99 I paid to rent it on amazon instant video.
This was a great purchase with no pitfalls. Object arrived exactly as expected and in great time. I love this site.

A good comedy. I'd only just watched it last night. I'll be renting the sequel. I'm a fan of Bradley Cooper. A batchelor party goes wrong. Mayhem ensues. Good script. Fantastic scene with a naked Mr. Chow leaping out of a car boot/trunk. He and Alan (Zach G) have the best lines. 'See you later gayboys' 'I didn't know they gave out rings during the holocaust' A varied soundtrack. The Hangover 3 is out in cinemas this summer. Be sure you order the dvd through Amazon.
Love this flick. If you're into crude humor then you gotta watch this. Beware, it has lots of vulgar words, nudity and sexual circumstances.
If you want something funny then watch this you will laugh until the very end!  I loved every minute of this movie!

You definitely have to be into the more raunchy comedies to like this movie.  If you are a fan of that kind of humor though this is great.  By now everyone knows the basic story, guys go to Vegas for a bachelor party and wake up the next day remembering nothing, but missing the groom.  The rest of the movie is them trying to piece together what happened and find the missing groom.

Of the main cast by far the standout was Zach Galifianakis playing the awkward and kind of creepy brother in law.  Ken Jeong also was great in his crazy kind of way.  He was a little too close to his character on Community in the crazy department, but the way he is introduced in the movie was very funny.  I also liked Justin Bartha as the missing groom.  Although he ultimately was not in the movie much, his deadpan sarcastic delivery was very good.  There were quite a few cameos in the film but the best by far was Mike Tyson.  He ended up being in a couple scenes and was actually very good.

While I don't think this was the best comedy of all time as some have billed it, it is very good.  Definitely one of the better ones in recent memory.  Like I said earlier this is not going to appeal to everyone, but if you like the type of humor then you will love this.
If you have not seen The Hangover you need to go get it. One of my all time favorite movies.

I am pretty sure that I am the last person in my entire family, extended members included, to have seen this movie. While the hype sucked some of the comedic sting out of my personal experience I still found this movie quite funny.

The plot is pretty rudimentary but attempts to generate an allure of mystery in medias res. The screenplay really shines by relying on quirky characters and absurd plot twists. Cameo appearances actually add to the screwiness without being campy.

Pictures added by the ending credits are also very funny and finish off the film well.  I rented this flick off of Amazon's Instant Video which was convenient, but had some quality issues.

For anyone interested in hookers, roofies, Mike Tyson, babies, tigers, and angry naked Chinese mobsters this is the movie for you.

This movie is not for the faint of heart or people who are easily offended. Here's the test, can you deal with this line: "What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas... except for... herpes... which, um, er, follows you home."

If that's no big deal, I think you'll really like this movie. The comic timing is well done, Mike Tyson nearly steals the show in a cameo, and the laughs come thick and fast. It's the funniest movie I'veseen in a number of years.

If you're easily offended, don't say you weren't warned.

Every time I see this movie I get a headache, with a smile thinking back to an altered experience. She still doesn't remember a thing. Location: Pre-Katrina NOLA. 4 blondes: 3 young German guys, 1 Texan girl (Sherri, my Homeslice); & a 115lb unconscious chick in a black tuxedo mini-dress. Tuxedo mini-dress chick drives from Miami Beach, FL, to New Orleans for a vacation from vacationland, meets Texan- Sherri; they become fast friends as protection from creepy middle aged conventioneer guys; girls go to buy Rare Earth Concert tickets and instead get hired as cocktail waitresses at concert. Free concert & extra $, "cool". Girlfriends meet mellow German dudes in lounge staying in girl's same hotel. All go to Pat O' Brien's for appetizers and drinks. They drink "HURRICANES!!!".

Fast Forward: Tuxedo mini-dress chick wakes to horrifying "Apocalypse Now" ceiling fan blades in empty hotel room with Souvenir Box: cable car driver inscripted: "you're not the first, and you won't be the last; to fall to the Hurricane!"

Tuxedo mini-dress chick finds out from traumatized German boys and laughing Texan chick, about their adventurous evening trying to get 115 lbs of young woman back home, unconscious, to the hotel. No cab would touch the scenario; the guyz took turns carrying her. Finally, a streetcar driver going their way told them to haul her in. The German boyz made the mistake of trying to wake "Sleeping Beauty", and she hurled all over everyone within a 5 ft. radius. Texas Sherri was so amused, only 2 drinks did Tuxedo in. All Tuxedo mini-dress knows is that she woke up beneath comfy linen and pillows, showered clean, alone, and with this Hurricane drink souvenir glass in a box with the inscription.

Notation: Before this incident, Sherri & Tuxedo always noticed passed out well-dressed conventioneer guys with their plastic name tags in the gutter with shoes missing and pockets turned inside out', never women, thank God! (Watch out, Ladies) :)

Who cares if it's been done before?! This is the best it has ever been done and with such intense creativity, nonetheless! Galifinakis is a genius and keeps your eyes glued on him the whole time (no one could have done his role better). Scene after scene, it gets better never allowing you to predict anything! I will be watching this movie for years to come... Ps don't forget the "pictures" at the end... EPIC!!

I have had so many people telling me how funny this movie was that I finally decided I had to buy it.  I was so glad I did!!  It was a riot!  I haven't laughed so much at a movie in a very long time. The friends/family guys in this movie take off to Vegas for a Batchelor party, and, accidentally, get slipped a date-rape drug, and when they awaken the next morning, they cannot remember what they did, where they went or how they lost the bridegroom to-be.  You get to follow along with them as they try to discover just exactly what DID happen in Vegas, and it is a funny adventure.  If you just enjoy having a real gut-buster, rolling-in-the-floor-laughing movie fest, start with this one!! It is guaranteed to put you in a great mood!  Loved it!

When it comes to a movie that will make you laugh to death, The Hangover is a perfect fit. This movie deserves 4/5 stars for its lessons, depictions, and incredibly funny suspense.

The Hangover is a comedy about four friends who go on a bachelor party in Las Vegas. One of them accidently gives them ruphies. They wake up the next morning knowing nothing. Even worse, they lost their friend. Then they go all around Las Vegas trying to find him.

I bought the movie in 2010 because everyone told me it was so funny. I didn't believe them but watching the film made me a believer.

The Hangover tells a good lesson on what not to do when you go to Las Vegas. The terrible things that happen to them tell you not to do it.

The movie shows a great depiction of the city of Las Vegas. It shows how beautiful the city is and what all you can do there. The film shows Ceasar's Palace and the many casinos there.

Finally, The Hangover has incredibly funny suspense. The things they go through to find their friend will make you laugh.
The only downside to the movie that I have found is that it is rated R so children cannot see it. You don't need to watch it with your kids.

If you're looking for a movie that will make you laugh to death, The Hangover is it.

This almost reminds me of the time I was looking forward to the west Hollywood special cheap Sunday beer bust only to notice on newspaper stand that it was Monday. Yes folks, this kind of drug induced alcohol related amnesia can happen given the right cosmic dust. Four buddies celebrate bachelor party in Las Vegas to discover expensive royal flat is into total mayhem complete with baby, animals, destruction, and missing unaccounted for partner who happens to be the groom. Many disarray pieces lay strewn about with only telltale clues from casual witnesses who happened to be there as well as quickie bride, victims of crime, and stolen articles. If anyone has seen the legendary comedy flick "It's a mad, mad, mad, mad world" then you know the unstoppable pace to this one as the three out of it buddies try to piece their whereabouts' and solve the mysteries of telltale leftovers and disappearing vehicle, plus missing buddie. A great romp of who did it, and why it happened as they gradually backtrack their drunken stupor steps, with a satisfying ending of tell all phone photographs after the mysteries have been solved for a pleasant closing credits roll.

Three of us watched this and laughed our arse off.  The characters were super funny. Chan was great.  Tyson good.  Heather Graham was sexy as usual. I enjoy all kinds of art. Highbrow this ain't but the extreme ludicrous-ness of the circumstances that befall these characters is so over-the-top, and the characters so likable and engaging with all their flaws, and the sheer joy of the ensemble playing, led masterfully by the smooth and daring Bradley Cooper, made this a must-have for my collection. I laughed out loud watching it alone in my room and plan to watch it over again and again over time when I need a lift or a two-hour vacation. Zack G. Practically steals the show with the character's off-the-wall thought processes but everyone shines, except for poor Justin Bartha who doesn't have much to do, a function of the plot. As memorable a film as any that were paraded on the red carpet at the glitzy awards ceremonies for the year 2009.

Surprised the writers and makers of The Hangover were not sued into penniless oblivion by the producers of the TV show "How I Met Your Mother" since the entire Hangover movie is a DIRECT and BLATANT rip-off of a 2005 season one episode of "How I Met Your Mother" entitled The Pineapple Incident.  In The Pineapple Incident, a character drinks five straight shots then "blacks out" and wakes up the next day (with an injury, a complete stranger in his bed and a pineapple) and can't remember how he ended up with any of these things due to his black out.  Then it becomes a MYSTERY with him and his friends trying to solve what occurred during his black out episode.  I mean the entire Hangover movie is an EXACT RIP-OFF of this episode.  The true writers of The Hangover are the "How I Met Your Mother" writers who wrote The Pineapple Incident.  They're the ones who invented the entire idea and premise of The Hangover.  The so-called writers of The Hangover--Jon Lucas and Scott Moore--are nothing by plagiarists and thieves.  And knowing that, there is no way I could ever recommend this movie to anyone.

THis movie is so funny. Definately not one that you watch with your 60 year old parents, but one you watch with your more crude friends. I purchased this for my brother-in-law who usually hates any fictional movie, but he loved this one.

A well-put together but absurd comedy about a wacky Wolf Pack, out for fun at a best friend's bachelor party. A great cameo by Michael Tyson is welcome, but the film is not as side-splittingly funny as it is awkward and uncomfortable; for truly side-splittingly funny (as well as some good scene stealing, and even some real character development), you need to look no further than the female version of The Hangover, which is called Bridesmaids. Of course, us guys can't admit that to other guys ("Huh? You thought a film called `Bridesmaids' was funnier than `The Hangover', which all of us have lived in our lives and can totally relate to? I haven't even heard of that film, much less seen it"), but it's actually true. The "oh-I-get-it-now" moment at the end is pure Scooby Doo, and the "henpecked boyfriend finally figures out that his girlfriend is a bitch" cliche resolution at the end is a bit superfluous. But don't get me wrong - the "Wolf Pack" speech alone is worth the price of admission, both for its surrealness as well as its twee naivete, as are the early scenes when Zach Galifianakis is introduced as the goofy brother-in-law. Good one, guys.

Gettin' ready for deja vu with the sequel...

Its not that I dislike "over the edge" humor (I liked Borat enough to buy it). The real problem with this film is that its just not that funny. Don't waste your time.

If you're a frat boy or wannabe, then this film was made with you in mind.  My husband and I got a free copy of it with a film-by-mail subscription.  I was looking forward to watching it, since I love stupid comedies like Airplane, Police Academy, and Naked Gun.  We tucked into it with some beer and Indian takeout.  First, I need to tell you that if your IQ is over 90, you are going to need to be drunk and/or high to make it through this.  It's immature without being fun and... god.  It just reminds me of some of the bad writing the boys used to do in high school English class, trying too hard to be cool; not witty, and not original.  All of the women in it are bad stereotypes and did I mention it's not very funny?  I feel like a grumpy old lady, but just Blues Brothers or something instead.

When three friends (Ed Helms, Zach Galifianakis and Bradley Cooper) finally come to after a raucous night of bachelor-party revelry, they find a baby in the closet and a tiger in the bathroom. But they can't seem to locate their best friend, Doug (Justin Bartha) -- who's supposed to be tying the knot. Launching a frantic search for Doug, the trio perseveres through a nasty hangover to try to make it to the church on time.

check out my full review @ [...]

Hands down the best comedy of last decade.
The photo album inside could be better... with ALL photos from the end of the movie.
Beside this... totally worth it!

That's probably the best way to describe this raunchy, far-fetched and ultimately hilarious adult oriented comedy. The characters are put in the most ridiculous situations as they attempt to recall the events of the previous night, and their responses and reactions are what drive the movie forward. This premise could easily have been made into a lesser movie (see Hangover II), but Todd Phillips takes them to the farthest edge of Vegas and beyond. Personally I don't recall ever laughing as hard as I did when the guys are just coming to after their debauchery and discovering what has happened to their hotel suite. If you're one of the 5 people or so who haven't see this yet, what are you waiting for? Comedy classic.

I received this product almost as soon as I ordered it. Very FAST delivery and I am ever so grateful! My husband and I watched it a few nights later and never laughed as hard at any other movie! Just plain HILARIOUS!! Great buy! And a MUST-buy!! LOL!!

People said they howled through this thing. I was just amused. If you don't take it seriously; If you suspend reasonable belief; If you don't let details get in the way OR are in college - this is the film for you.  The scene where the guys are being used for taser targets is the best.  Okay, you're getting married and you let your two best buds and your future brother-in-law take you to Vegas for one last night with the boys as a free man. Throw in heavy drinking, rohipnol (roofies) and Vegas and you'll get a night you will never remember.  A tiger in the bathroom, chickens in the suite, a missing tooth, a baby in the closet, the future groom is missing and the very expensive Mercedes future Daddy-in-law let you borrow for the trip has been traded for a police car.  You now have 9 hours to unravel the mystery of where the hell's the groom and who's kid is this or you'll never make it to the church on time. Saw the unrated version. Don't know if it was different from the theatrical one.  Pass the popcorn.
This is probably one of the funniest movies that I've ever seen. Although just be aware that the unrated has male frontal nudity but as long you're ok with that you will love the movie.

This was one of the most original and funniest comedies of the year! I'm sure there were a few things that were not cut, as well as some additional blooper reels, but it truly would have been hard to beat the theater release.

Each character had his own part to play, and played it very well-- it only takes about 15 minutes to completely understand the depth each character has, and how each one becomes integral to the plot, and the situation in which they find themselves.  Ridiculous? Yes. Possible? Unlikely. Hilarious? Absolutely.

I had umpteen people tell how gut busting hilarious this movie was (just like The Wedding Crashers.) Most over rated comedy in the same league as "the W.Crashers," and "Dodgeball." Cheap, been there, heard that punch lines, done better elsewhere at that. And people laughing because the rest of the lemmings are. This movie is so weak, so h.s. lunchroom humor, that it made me shudder at all the claims of greatness. It's not bad. But the fact I didn't laugh mostly until the credits says a lot about this flick. I ain't saying you won't find parts of this movie funny. But even Super Bowl commercials with groin shots gets laughs. I'll bet if put on a polygraph, many who claim this movie great would electricute themselves.
This is a great film. Make sure you get the 108 min version and not the 100 min version. There is also a 128 min version, which I am not familiar with.

My face hurt the next day after watching this movie from laughing so hard.- no kidding. This is the funniest movie in the last 10 years. the editing was done well & the script also. Most of the story goes backwards with the guys trying to figure out what happened last night. I hope the sequel is as good as the the first one.

My husband and I just sat through 14 minutes of forced DVD previews that we can not skip, stop or avoid.  If there are DVD features that even the menu button or online tricks to stop/start can't fix then Warner Brothers is FORCING us to watch previews and ads?  I don't think so!

In the past month we have purchased two DVD's that had the same problem.  I returned them both to the retailers and said they were broken - to me they were broken.

Seriously, if I own the DVD, I don't need to see 14 minutes of previews for other movies.  If I want a "movie experience" I go to the movies.

Does your car force you sit through a sales pitch every time you put in the key?  Does the Bank force you read a "free checking" brochure while you wait in line?  Does the supermarket force you to go down every aisle if all you want to buy is milk?

All studios are going to do is upset customers.  When they force viewers to watch their paid ads, all they are doing is forcing us to walk away from their content.  By the time the movie starts, we've lost interest... I can say for SURE that I will avoid Warner Bros. movies, for this reason alone.

Next stop, FaceBook, my blog, and comments on sites that sell WB titles.  Let's see what the social network of friends, colleagues and the rest of the online community think of their heavy-handed advertising.  Happy customers are the best advertising - unhappy customers are like a virus.  Congratulations, WB, you have started your very own virus factory!  From now on, I will let the forced previews play in the "muted" background and use that time to post complaints in as many sites as possible.

It looks like after this review, I'll still have another 12 minutes of writing ahead of me.  Cheers!
not good save your money best parts are end credits might  be good if you were drunk and don't remeber it rated pu for it stunk
you have seen this you will want to own it. if you haven't seen it you will want to own it. just buy it.

I purchased this DVD because it's one of my favorite movies, threw away the receipt, wanted to watch the move a week late and guess what - sound quality was so poor I had to increase the volume to the highest and still could barely hear anything!  Now this DVD is also in garbage and I purchased another one from Best Buy.  I guess you get what you pay for! :(((

This was huge sleeper hit but boy does it start off super slow. The first 20 minutes i did not laugh once and wondered what all the fuss was about. The movie was, frankly, plain boring but once we find the guys waking up in their suite the night after, then it starts to rock.

There are plenty of great twists even to what you think is a linear plot. Throw in a gratuitous expose breast of Heather Graham, gratuitous Mike Tyson, a tiger, a baby, a missing tooth and stolen police car, and you have a movie.

It does fall into that typical Hollywood movie stereotypes. You get the stripper with a heart of gold, the bitchy live-in girlfriend, a Rain Man-like winning streak at the tables and plenty of car crashes.

With better film editing this thing could have been off the charts funny. As it is it's a good laugh but nothing like Doug Liman's Go in its ability to capture Vegas today (and even that movie was smart in using Vegas for only a third of its movie).

Lastly, there are zero extras on this DVD release. All you get is the wide- and full-screen versions of the movie.

The Hangover is a comedy that is overrated, and only fitfully funny. It amazes me that this has a 7.9 on imdb.com. I'm convinced that a lot of teenage boys rated it highly, thinking it is so cool to hear the "f" word said 100 times in an hour and a half. And I am no prude. I liked Scary Movie, The 40-Year-Old Virgin, and most of the movies in the American Pie series. But all of those movies had just as many laughs as raunch. The Hangover is funny in spots, but it has more cuss words than laughs. Zach Galifianakis and Mike Tyson are the only actors who got big laughs from me.
This is the funniest movie I have watched in a long time. Great actors and actresses. I would not hesitate to buy this as a gift!
All the acting was so good in this movie. You go on a ride watching this. I wasn't laughing every second but it was so well written and very original.

I loved this movie. I was shocked to see so many low ratings on here. It's a really good time. There are some great cameos in this movie, and it was cast superbly. It has a bit of the feel of a Benny Hill episode or perhaps a Curb Your Enthusiasm. Things keep going more and more and more wrong for these guys. But it never feels heavy. As bad as things get, it's all still hilarious.

Basic premise: a bunch of guys go to Vegas for a bachelor party. They start the night with a little chemical assistance and wake up the next morning in a trashed room, with no memories of what happened the night before, and missing the groom. The rest of the movie is trying to piece everything back together and find, or perhaps rescue, their friend.

I was looking forward to this movie, based on some enthusiastic word of mouth from a couple of acquaintances. As I stared at the screen with my expression becoming blank, then black, and without ever laughing out loud, all I could think of was that some movies make you look differently at the people who recommend them. "The Hangover" is a base, empty mess, wrapped in some slick packaging and hype.

I know the party line, from some, but certainly not other, reviews: the movie is a wild, gross-out fun ride that goes down smooth. Quirky buddies try to reconstruct a wild bachelor party night in Las Vegas after they black out and wake up the next day in their trashed hotel suite, with their friend the groom missing. They are a supposedly likable bunch of a weird-acting stoner slob, a dorky dentist with a domineering, unfaithful long-time girlfriend, an irresponsible, self-centered hunk, and a dour boy scout. In their adventures, they encounter colorful characters, like smart-mouth cops, a sleazy owner of a quickie wedding chapel, and Mike Tyson (magically rich, no longer bankrupt, with some canned eccentricities added).

The problem is that the movie does nothing but string together a series of gags -- either crude or violent or both -- that grow more and more depressing the clearer it becomes that everything about the movie is shallow, phony, and clich. The missing night reconstructed over the course of the movie, with any remaining graphic details gratuitously laid on thick over the end credits, is strikingly unimaginative. (Drunken time with hookers; the drunk, hen-pecked dork marries a single-mom hooker with a heart of gold and then falls for her for real; the awkward slob as genius at cards; the groom swearing renewed, undying devotion to his fianc; trashing fancy and cop cars; stuck-up, rich parents of the bride, totally wasting Jeffrey Tambor.) As to the mattress tossed from high up down on top of the hotel statue, it is an embarrassing plot contrivance, conveniently to delay finding the groom, that no one investigates until the last minute the source of the damage (including the police or hotel staff, who would know better than anyone that it was a hotel mattress, that none of the hotel windows open, and that hotel cameras would have picked it all up). The rush back to L.A. and happy endings are pat, forced, and uninteresting.

Like a self-indulgent child, the movie wants to have it both ways -- the buddies are supposed to be relatable, down-to-earth guys, yet somehow manage to reserve a $4500/night luxury Vegas "villa," come up with fancy clothes at will, and all have hot-looking girlfriends, wives, fiancs, or families. The movie goes for cheap laughs early on by having the slob say he has to stay away by law from schools and parks, yet later treats his carrying around a baby, even making lewd gestures with its hand, as all part of the fun. The same tendency is true of the film's use throughout of what it calls this "fat man" as a pratfalling, publicly urinating punching bag; turning him into an instant genius at cards; his casual talk about using the drug ecstasy; and the film's use of slurs to describe the dorky dentist. The hunk, portrayed as a jerk and not in the least believable as a "school teacher," suddenly becomes a devoted family man at the end, hanging all over his wife and son and later even carrying his sleeping son over his shoulder while he leers at cell phone pictures taken by one of his buddies of nude women they made out with in Vegas, as well as of the dentist's bloody, stupidly smiling face after drunkenly pulling out one of his front teeth that night on a dare. The movie does not even manage to convey any genuine sense of joy to the adventures, even as it seems to glorify them, including lots of senseless destruction (like trashing hotel rooms and cars, someone getting shot, an effeminate, foul-mouthed Asian beating people with a tire-iron, the tooth-pulling, etc.).

Add to this these points recently made by a print reviewer about the movie:  "I didn't think 'The Hangover' was all that funny.  It was too choppy, too mean-spirited and too much of an ensemble that didn't fit together as well as it should have."  (As to the embarrassingly uncritical pass Roger Ebert gave this movie, like so many others, it only reminds me why I always liked Gene Siskel so much better.)

Why sweat any of this? It's about drunken partying, right? Identify with it. Go with the flow. It's not about making sense or taking anything seriously. If that works for you, fine. Maybe this is one of those movies where someone likes almost everything or almost nothing.  All a reviewer can do is explain why s/he feels one way or the other. For the reasons discussed, what is bad or weak about the movie so overwhelms anything good about it that the above excuses come across to this reviewer as just a convenient, lame cop-out.  A cop-out here for failing to entertain in any meaningful sense of the word and in the process not merely disappointing, but spoiling the time of, plenty of people who were looking forward to a good time at the movies.

Director Todd Phillips has done that rarest of things with this film--made an actually hilarious comedy, not one that is a corny embarrassment to both oneself and the people around them. Example:(Hot Tub Time Machine. Four guys--Phil Wenneck (Bradley Cooper), Ed Helms (Stu Price), Zach Galifianakis (Alan Garner in an eccentric turn of brilliance as a sage-like manchild), and soon-to-be-married Doug Billings (Justin Bartha) decide to hit Vegas and have a wild time before their friend gets hitched. Not before encountering a very angry Mike Tyson, a sociopathic gay Chinese gangster, and a bunch of Indian guys who run a compromised church for intoxicated men looking to get "married". Nearly every turn of dialogue in this movie is an exercise in self or-other deprecating black humor punctuated by strange moments of compassion. If he works it right, Phillips could be the future of contemporary comedy. There is a sequel in the works. This just about hits the mark of Kids in the Hall - Brain Candy and of course Office Space - Special Edition with Flair (Widescreen Edition). Not just recommended, this is a MUST SEE. (I've heard rumors that actor Bradley Cooper is going to star in a remake of "The Crow". I sure hope that's not true, disrespectful as that would be to Brandon Lee's memory.)

Super fast shipping, this was a great gift for my husband.  He was excited and we've watched it sooo many times.  What a great movie, for adults.  I am very excited to see the sequel.  Lots of swears and a bit of crude humor, but all in good fun.  The actors are amazing.  Highly recommend seeing this and adding it to your collection.

I saw this one in the theater and counted the days until it was released onto DVD. I laughed as hard watching at home as I did in the first run. This film inspired me to book a trip to Sin City in '09 and seeing it again and again only makes me want to go back. This is a buddy film to the n-th degree and this combo is spot on. I am ready to buy tix to the 2nd now

I've been looking for a palm tree necklace like the one Kate Hudson wore in the movie Fools Gold. After searching for awhile I found this one from Celebrity Silver and it arrived today (3 days after I ordered it), it's perfect. I love it, just like the one in the movie!

I loved this movie! It's never going to be as funny as the first time you watch it, when you don't know the mystery, but I still get a kick out of it and every time I watch it, I like it more. I don't want to reveal too much to anyone who hasn't seen it, but with a title like "The Hangover" and the tagline "Some guys just can't handle Vegas" you can pretty much see where this is going. It's chock full of all those delicious Vegas bachelor party cliches we know and love.

If you don't like cliches, raunchy frat-humor and bad language, this is not the movie for you. This is definitely a "your mileage my vary" movie. Not everyone will like it, but hey, everyone has preferences and I respect that. I'm all for being intellectual and sophisticated (I'm currently in the middle of reading Les Miserables; great book, btw), but sometimes even the most refined among us needs to revel in a little bit of stupid-funny.

Two thumbs up!

If you would like to see a movie that will have you laughing from the very beginning all the way through the credits, then "The Hangover" has just what you are looking for. The title of the movie is just the beginning as the main characters-Alan, Stu and Phil-stagger through a day of trying to piece together how they lost their friend Doug (the groom), find him and get back to California in time for his wedding.
During the course of this flick, Alan, Stu and Phil discover they stole a Las Vegas Police Department patrol car, Stu married a stripper after his pulled out his own tooth because he could (Stu is a dentist). Did I mention the new married Stu has an infant stepson named Tyler (yes the stripper wife is his mom!).  They also discover Phil was admitted to the emergency room and get arrested for stealing the police car. Upon their release they get their car (Mercedes Benz) back only to find a naked Chinese "gangster" in the trunk with which they later find they have an eighty thousand dollar debt.  Also, I cannot leave out the appearance of Mike Tyson and his body guard and the tiger.
 I can promise that this movie will leave you in "stitches" and have you wondering what you could do to have a night like Doug, Phil, Stu and Alan.

Everyone has heard of the phrase "Chick Flick" and knows exactly what that means, so I won't insult everyone's intelligence by defining it. Films for guys--without all the obligatory explosions, car chases, macho posturing, bulging muscles, and like-minded catch-phrases--seem to be rare. This movie, however, fills that void. In that sense, it would be qualified as a "Dick Flick". My better half and I saw this at the theatre, and while she (and I) laughed at all the funny bits, I found myself also giggling at all points in between. At one point, she turned and looked at me as if to say, "What are you giggling at ?!" I just nodded and replied, "I can relate to this!"
Very good comedy about male shenanigans. Highly recommended.
The Hangover is one of my favorite movies, ever. It's just so over the top with everything. I love it.

If you're an academic kind of person who knows "Wuthering Heights," "Grapes of Wrath," "Of Mice and Men," "To Kill a Mockingbird," "Moby Dick," "Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde," "The Prince and the Pauper," "A Tale of Two Cities," "A Place In The Sun," "Red Badge of Courage," "The Long Goodbye," "The Maltese Falcon," "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer," "For Whom the Bell Tolls," "Gone With The Wind," "A Raisin in the Sun," Lilies of the Field," "A Farewell to Arms," "Little Women," "The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn," "Death of a Salesman," "The Great Gatsby," and "The Outsiders" were all required reading in high school that have been made into movies and you critically compare those DVD movies to the culture value of the books for merit and authenticity, this movie I'm reviewing may not be for you unless you also have a second ability in your repertoire of personality that allows for a sense of humor and allowance for finding amusement also necessary.  If you do have that extra quality, then by all means, there's hope for you to enjoy "The Hangover."
"The Hangover" is an absolutely hilarious film starring Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms, Zach Galifianakis, Justin Bartha, Heather Graham, Sasha Barrese, Ken Jeong, Rachael Harris, Mike Tyson, Mike Epps, and others; about 4 guys who go to Las Vegas and end up having the ultimate time of their lives.  Only bad thing is they can't remember a damn thing and have to figure out what the heck happened.  This film is the perfect nightmare I've had most of my life that keeps me from going to Las Vegas.  Absurdity abounds and comedy is non-stop.  You can't help yourself and start laughing about fifteen minutes in, and then you just keep on laughing all the way to the end.  There is a sequel planned, and I'm going to get it, too.  Do yourself a favor and own this DVD.  Heather Graham was my favorite character BTW.  Good grief this DVD is a great choice IMHO.

..if the universal glowing praise for this film is any indication.  The Amazon editorial review for this movie opens with, "If you like your humor broadside up, hold the subtlety...", which just about perfectly describes most of the 20 to 50 year old bracket in this country.  Just to clarify, since most of the readers in favor with this piece of frivolous dog dung lack the ability to even pick up on any "subtlety", this is a NEGATIVE review.

After hearing several people in my life, including my own mother, join this chorus of glowing praise and "non-stop" hilarity, I figured there had to be something to this movie despite how utterly stupid the trailer looked.  I proceeded to waste 2 hours of my life and actually sit through this whole thing, just waiting for that hilarious moment to occur....which NEVER happens in the entire running time of the movie.

Not that the plot matters at all nor gives any significance to the film's random sophomoric "humor", but The Hangover, starring a few who cares-beens, is a movie about a few friends who take their soon to be hitched buddy to a Vegas bachelor party to live it up before the ball and chain consumes the rest of his life.  Off screen, these geniouses get so feces faced, they end up losing their friend, stealing a cop car, a tiger (somehow without getting mauled), and a vulgar naked Asian man, among other rediculous (and similarly unfunny) things.  And, you guessed it..."hilarity" ensues...in the form of endlessly recycled and forced gags taken straight of the playbook of MUCH better but not even great films in their own right such as Animal House and Dumb and Dumber (without ANY of the subtle humor that actually made that film watchable), and other manurish films such as the similarly overrated Old School (or any Will Farrell "comedy" for that matter).  Oh, that's right, I have to spell it out for you like this sans-subtlely movie..I am comparing this crap movie to crap Will Farrell.

Not even the much hyped cameo by Iron Mike could save this turkey.  I appreciate Tyson's willingness to self deprecate himself, but it was as forced and witless as the rest of the movie.  Which brings me to the focal point of this movie's failure..the jokes are forced and witless, right in front of your face, not requiring any work or grasping of subtle texture to get the point.  Now that we live in an age where anything goes, acceptable comedy is comprised of just throwing anything out there, as long as it's outlandish and vulgar.  I guess the sentiment as that we all work hard enough at work and don't want to work for our comedy.  And that's a shame..

I am glad to see the 85'ish or so other one star reviews prove I am not the only one who refuses to wallow in a sea of mediocrity with the rest of the sheep of this age of American comedy.  However, this film's Golden Globes "Best Comedy" win may suggest that we will continue to dig well below the barrel.

The movie got to my home at an extremely fast speed. it was packaged great and no harm occurred to the movie. this movie is one of my favorites and I got it with fast shipping and at a great price. Thanks.
This movie is hilarious every time, but the first time I saw it, my cheeks literally hurt from laughing so much! Way better than I expected!

This movie is not the funniest or drop dead funny like most will say, it is funny and a good film but overrated by many IMO!  It is like we watched a different movie, old school is funnier and better to me.  This is a good flick, but not what some crack it up to be, jumps into plot way too fast and overall just not as funny as some act.  I was hardly in tears watching this flick.

Very funny movie with an interesting take on a bachelor party. I don't think it is as funny as Old School, but it is definitely the best comedy in the last couple of years. If you liked this movie you should check out: Old School, Dodgeball, Forgetting Sarah Marshall, Superbad, and Role Models.
It came just how it said it would; packaged and new!  Also, I received it in a timely manner!

`The Hangover' is a goofy comedy about a stag night in Las Vegas that goes horribly wrong when the stags wake up in the morning with a tiger in the bathroom (!), absolutely no recollection of the night before and a missing groom. The film quickly descends into frantic farce as they try to retrace their steps and find the lost groom before it is too late. The actor who plays Andy (Zach Galifianakis) is particularly good and makes this film a whole lot funnier and the other actors manage to keep things speeding along whilst raising laughs at regular intervals. This has a real `old school' vibe about it and reminded me of various comedies from the 80's and if you enjoyed the off-the-wall comedies from that era then this will be right up your street. There are plenty of cliches and obvious jokes but they are delivered so well you can't help but laugh despite yourself. You even get a cameo appearance from Mike Tyson who is pretty funny as well. The various elements the stags have to track down and uncover to find the groom keep the story interesting and make you want to keep watching to find out how various things occurred and how they lead to the groom; like a funny detective story. This is a film that doesn't try to take itself too seriously and sets out to deliver some laughs by the time the film ends and whilst it isn't ground shaking or the best comedy I have ever seen, it does achieve it's goal and had me chuckling at points throughout. Worth a look at some point.

While I am not typically fond of this type of film, "The Hangover" is laugh-out-loud hilarious.  I have watched it several times, and it still makes me laugh.  While the storyline is farfetched, the actors do a great job pulling it off.  Warning: It is definitely deserving of its R rating.

The Hangover has to be the Best Movie I have seen lately and my Favorite So far, A movie doesn't have to have Will Ferrell in order for it to be funny,and in a Age when modern movies really stink it is a welcome refreshment, From Carlos the Baby and The Tiger in The Bathroom to Paging Dr. Fa..et...  And The Chinese Guy, The movie is more Bizarre than Dude Where's My Car, Friggin' Hilarious.

I love movies with this type of crude humor but I have to admit that watching 'The Hangover' felt like a huge waste of time. It wasn't nearly as funny as the previews made it out to be. On the plus side, Heather Graham as the Vegas stripper was hilarious. Bradley Cooper's not all that funny but he's a pretty good actor. And the fat hairy man was very amusing (although in some of his scenes it looked like he was trying too hard).

But the actor that plays the groom has about as much personality as beige wall paint. His acting was boring and monotone. Good thing he didn't have too many scenes. And the toothless man should stick to 'The Office' - he's much more funny and witty on that TV show. I was expecting a whole lot more from this movie. There wasn't a lot of originality. A lot of what happened in the film were just cut-and-pasted clichs that I've seen in other movies. It just makes you roll your eyes and think, "Haven't I seen this before in another movie?". For example, the scene with the tiger in the bathroom has already been used in other movies before but with different animals and not necessarily in the bathroom. Plus, it's also kinda sad how they used this  majestic wild creature that should be in the wild (or at least in a reservation) for cheap laughs. I wish they would have just used some visual effect like CGI because when they train wild animals to become "actors" they basically take away their chances of having a normal, healthy life. There were some funny parts in this movie but I had expected a lot more from the way it was promoted and talked about. I thought maybe it was just me, but a lot of people I've talked to - both male and female - have also said that they thought it would be a lot better and were kinda disappointed. I think 'The Hangover' is mostly a lot of hype. If you're over the age of 12 and you've already seen a lot of contemporary American films with this type of humor, then chances are you will find this movie clichd, unoriginal, predictable, and trying-too-hard.

If you haven't yet seen it, I recommend 'Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy' which is also a crude/stupid type of comedy. It's a lot funnier and a whole lot more original. This movie is basically about a group of very very stupid male colleagues and their top rated newsman, Ron Burgundy (played by Will Ferrell), in San Diego's male dominated broadcasting world of the 1970's. When an ambitious new female employee (played by Christina Applegate) arrives, Ron Burgundy starts to feel very threatened by her and chaos ensues. This movie was (slightly) educational because it shows you what things were like in the workforce back in the 70s and how much society's changed in some ways. The Christina Applegate/Will Ferrell duo was hilarious and a lot fun to watch. And they had a very funny supporting cast which added a lot of laughs.

I'm 58 years old...and, still found this movie hysterical!

their favorite movies!
