While, it doesn't offer too much unseen footage, it does give you a great gag reel and a fantastic commentary by actors Bradley Cooper, Zach Galifinaskis, Ed Helms, and director Todd Phillips. They are not only gracious, but also hilarious and informative. I recommend getting this DVD one hundred percent!
One of the funniest movies I've seen in a long time.  If you like irreverant movies, this is a must see.

If you were born in England or over 50 you'd know that "Rubbish" was a famous punchline from "Morecombe and Wise", which aired on British Television from 1968 to 1984 (lot's of clips on Youtube).  The reason that "Rubbish" is so appropriate a title to describe "The Hangover" is that it captures the difference in comedy styles since the 1960s so well.  In the 1960s if a character in a film robbed someone you'd know that by the end of the film he/she would either loose the money or go the jail, it was an unwritten code that the filmmakers kept to.  After working in the television industry for 20 years I'm saddened by the gradual decay of writting standards in film and television. Now days there is no code, no class or dialogue in films, "sh.t, f..k", that's what considered dialogue and your suppose to laugh at it! Sorry folks, I'm not 12 I won't laugh because you say so!  Now I'm no prude I don't find swearing offence, what I find offence is that the filmmakers think that we are all 10 years old.  The filmmaker knows he's lazy but he's only writing for Hollywoood, not Bollywood which would require a much higher standard of class.  In "The Hangover" people steal Police cars without going to jail, people bounce Mercedes off of trucks, walls, and get it T-boned and their still driving it! Not going to happen folks.  People steal live Tigers when they're drunk yet can't stay in the same room with the cat when they're sober!  If you can ignore reality, these scenes could be funny, but then your faced with the 4 guys being the biggest bunch of jerks you'll every meet, they act stupider than preschoolers.  You're hoping half way through that someone would shoot them and remove them from polluting the gene pool.  I'm sorry I really don't understand the hype (score Marketing 1, Film quality 0)here.  One thing I know for sure it that this film will never be shown on AMC (American Film Classics).  If you found this film funny then you'll love "The Three Stooges", I recommend "A Plumbing we will Go", it was one of their better shorts and it will be a considerable increase intellectual content.
I ordered The Hangover and it arrived in perfect condition, still in the plastic and in a good amount of time.
I expected this comedy to be a "guy" thing, but it was incredibly funny to all of us.  Many twists and turns in the story including many scenes that are so hysterical, I couldn't stop laughing!

After all the hype and critical praise for this movie, I expected to laugh through much of this movie. I didn't. There were some funny scenes and lines, but it was seldom more than enough to make me chuckle. I didn't really sympathize with the main characters much. While I sometimes enjoy sophomoric humor, such as "American Pie", I really didn't find much of the sophomoric humor here to be truly funny. The "gag reel" included as an extra made me laugh harder than the movie itself.

Doug is about to be married so he goes on a road trip to Las Vegas with his soon-to-be brother-in-law Alan and best friends Phil and Stu. Alan is described as everything from weird to dumb by his family and strangers alike; I found him to be the only really entertaining character in the bunch. Phil is a teacher with a wife and kid who hates his life and is looking to let it all out on the road trip. After seeing his wife and son later in the movie, I didn't understand why he would be so unhappy. Stu is a dentist who's about to propose his girlfriend despite the fact she doesn't seem to know the real him, tries to control his life, and cheated on him.

The boys plan for one wild night in Vegas and get more than they planned for. Alan, Phil, and Stu wake up in their expensive hotel suite to find Doug is missing, Stu is missing a tooth, and there's a tiger in the bathroom and a baby in the closet. In order to find Doug in time for the wedding the following day, they try to retrace their steps during the night none of them can remember. Soon they discover one of them got married to a stripper, who is played by Heather Graham and who seems to be a better character than most of the others. In the end, they get involved with the police, an Asian mafia-type after some money, and Mike Tyson.

Somehow it sounds funnier than it actually ends up being. Yes, there were some funny lines, but there was also more than a fair share of jokes and insults more suitable to a high school. I've never been the type who wanted to spend a raucous night in Vegas like they did, so I can't sympathize much. The characters come across mostly as stupid and immature, deserving of what happens to them. At the same time, I didn't get all that much pleasure out of seeing what was done to them. Some of the funniest parts of the movie were a couple songs, especially Stu's song at the piano while they waited for the tiger to fall asleep. Alan (Zach Galifianakis) is still the funniest character and was probably given the best lines. It is good to see Zach Galifianakis get some recognition, he deserves it. Overall, the movie was funny at times but ultimately I was left disappointed and wondering what all the hype is about.
One of the few movies I'll really get my money out of because I'll watch it over and over.  NB - There's no Digital Copy in this version.

This movie kept me laughing through the whole thing.  The dumb brother in-law being able to count cards was good and the sense with Mike Tyson was funny too.  The idea of putting a baby in the closet and having a person who is suspected of being a pedophile taking care of him is a bad idea.  For a comedy it is funny these guys would do that.  With them loosing the groom and trying to remember what happened the night before and not letting the bride know was funny.  This is very much worth the watching, but it is not for younger viewers.  I would recommend this to someone who can forget the morality and the idea of how they treat the baby.  It was just done for comedy  purposes and it will keep you rolling on the floor. THE HANGOVER

STARRING: Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms, Zach Galifianakis, Justin Bartha, Heather Graham, Sasha Barrese, Ken Jeong, Jeffrey Tambor, Rachael Harris, Mike Epps and Mike Tyson

WRITTEN BY: Jon Lucas and Scott Moore

DIRECTED BY: Todd Phillips

Rated: R
Genre: Comedy
Release Date: 05 June 2009

We've seen its premises countless times: guys go to Vegas for a bachelor party; unplanned shenanigans involving strippers, the police, unruly side characters and drugs and alcohol ensue; and of course what happens in Vegas, stays in Vegas. But it's the unique and vivid style in which it's delivered to us, that makes The Hangover not only the funniest comedy of 2009, but also the best comedy of the last few years.

Going in, I expected it to be exactly what it could have very easily been: the movie described in the previous paragraph. However, we don't even see the bachelor party.

The film opens with Phil (Bradley Cooper) and his two pals on the side of the road in the desert. Between them they have a busted lip, a missing tooth, a hospital bracelet and filthy clothes. Phil makes a dreadful phone call informing a would-be bride, that they are unable to locate her groom. When she reminds him that they are to be married in a few short hours, he apathetically replies, "Yeah... that's not gonna happen."

We jump back to before they left for Vegas and meet the characters. Phil is a school teacher who sees nothing wrong with lying to the kids about a made-up field trip, and using the money they hand over, to fund the bachelor party. Stu (Ed Helms) is a dentist who calls himself a doctor, and has his entire life ran for him by his moody and severely overly strict girlfriend. Alan (Zach Galifianakis) is beyond strange and is only invited to come along as a favor to the bride, as he is her brother. And we meet Doug (the groom), played by Justin Bartha.

We follow them on the road to Vegas, where they check into an insanely expensive room and everything seems to be going a-ok. Then they toast to the first drink and... wake up the next day, seriously hung-over and used and abused by God knows what happened. When Stu asks "Why can't we remember anything from last night?"; Phil delivers one of my favorite lines in the film by responding, "Obviously because we had a great f***ing time."

The room is absolutely destroyed; a bowling ball stuck in the middle of the wall, a tiger in the bathroom, and a chicken walking around aimlessly. Oh, and did I mention the infant they find in the closet? And of course, Doug is no-where to be found.

From there they begin to use what little clues they have, to help point them in the right direction as to where Doug might be. It's wildly entertaining and devilishly funny. The movie never misses a laugh or skips a beat. Having recently seen The Hangover for a second time; I can tell you it only gets funnier with additional viewings.

The amazing Todd Phillips directs this comedic masterpiece as brilliantly as he has done with his treasures of the past, to include: Road Trip, Old School, Starsky & Hutch and School for Scoundrels. There is an excellent soundtrack, and the cinematography is top-notch, to boot.

The film is dirty at times but it is never tasteless or witless. It's beautifully and cleverly written and contains at least a dozen one-liners that will live on forever. It may have several clich elements found in numerous similar films of this genre, but it does marvelous things with them.

For instance: the scene where Doug is given the keys to his future father-in-law's prized car, to take to Vegas. You know it's gonna be all smashed to hell or blown up by the end of the movie, but what they do with it here was genius. Or how about the fact that Stu lied to his insane girlfriend about going to Vegas. Think she might find out? Who cares - everything ties together all the way from the first act to the third, and we appreciate the effort the writers put forth. If they are half as talented at writing action / sci-fi as they are at comedy, Michael Bay should hire them for the third Transformers film.

The casting was perfected to a T. Everyone nails their character dead-on. Bradley Cooper is sincere as a guy who just wants to have a good time and can keep his cool when things don't go as planned. Ed Helms makes an excellent worrier when nothing goes as planned. And Zach Galifianakis was born to be the guy to cause everything to not go as planned.

The Hangover will undoubtedly do for Galifianakis' career, what Tommy Boy did for Chris Farley. The man is already practically a comedic icon. He plays Alan exactly as Stu describes Alan's character, "Don't let the beard fool you. He's a child." Alan doesn't swear, he goes out for a night of partying in Vegas wearing a T-shirt with a painting of a wolf and he explains to the guys he won't be able to hang with them when they get back, because the Jonas brothers will be in town. We believe that Alan would behave the way he does and say the strange and sometimes moronic things he does, in every scene. Perhaps the best example of this would be when Stu tells him that his grandmother's holocaust ring is missing and Alan replies, "I didn't know they gave out rings at the holocaust."

That's just one of many, folks. See it. After all, The Hangover has made cinematic history by becoming the highest grossing R-Rated comedy of all time.

I absolutely adore this movie, the cast, the comedy, etc. Great unrated version of the film is a must watch as well as the bonus features. Wish there could have been a bit more in the bonus area but was overall pleased with this movie. Highly recommended comedy movie.

i saw this movie three times in the theatres when it was out, and once in a hotel room while i was on the road, then i had to have it when it was released, but it was sold out everywhere. lol- one of the funniest no stop movies i have seen in a long long time, it covers all of the crazy things possible to happen to a person lost in the jungles of a bachlor party and in vegas. And we all have friends like these guys that we can identify with, which makes it ten times funnier and sends you n this non stop adventure ride to save a friend, have a great time and make it to the wedding on time. This movie is highly entertaining and worth adding to your collection. At times I identified with the characters (not in a proud way)and at other times I thanked god that I was not them. I know many woman that thought this was hilarious and many that didn't. My wife did not sit through the whole thing...meanwhile I am watching it 18 times giggling like a fool. So maybe it is more of a "guys" movie. I don't know. What I do know is that this is worth the money. Enjoy!

I'm not just saying that because of an increase of outlandish scenes and behavior but because there is a lot more exposition and backstory to thicken the plot a bit. Everyone has said a lot but seeing Vegas through the joy of Blu Ray was a real treat. The endless onslaught of surprises wasn't at all tiring but I suppose my favorite subplot would have to be the entire Mike Tyson story: from the sudden appearance in their hotel room to the song Ed Helms sings on the grand piano (freakin' hilarious!) to the replaying of the security video of the night the "deed" happened. It was all superb. The express tux delivery on the highway was a touching guy moment that I can't explain.
  Some folks have complained that the women in Todd Phillips movies are either whores or shrews. That may be true. But that's because it is a GUY MOVIE. Similarly in GIRL MOVIES, guys are either the loyal gay pal of the main girl character, oversexed gigilos, Mr. Right or (the worst by far) the guy-who-isn't-right-for-her-and-so-loyally-steps-aside-so-she-can-be-happy-because-he-likes-her-that-much guy. People don't watch these sort of comedies for reality, they watch them for cariacature and representation of folks from their own circle of friends.
  The Hangover isn't just a thing of shock value, there is a heart there and a fully earned one not a taped-on one like many comedies these days. You'll enjoy it!

You never find out what happened. It is like they made this movie up as they went. I don't get why so many young people like this one. Goods with Jeremy Piven was much better. This is a boring long winded story that makes no sense.

My sister and I caught this movie in our hotel room while taking a vacation together. It was so hysterical we even paid to watch it a second time. Every time you watch it you catch more little things going on. It's just so clever, and well written. I bought a copy for myself and one for her, so we could watch it at home with our husbands. It's our new favorite movie. Needless to say, we identify with these guys, for when we go on vacation, we often spend the mornings trying to figure out what went on the night before.

I've seen this comedy twice, two days in the row. First, with my husband, and then on the New Year Eve, with the company of friends. Everyone enjoyed it and laughed a lot. I liked it both times, the second time as much as the first one, and this is not usually my kind of comedies. I prefer my comedy more sophisticated, subtle, witty, but Hangover somehow won me over. It started and ended fairly predictable, but in the middle - the night that four friends spent conquering Las Vegas and throwing the bachelor party to end all bachelor parties, of which they have no recollection the following morning, -this part of the movie was very funny. Just to picture once again in my mind the battle field that their posh hotel suite in the Cesar's Palace has became, with the Bengal tiger occupied the bathroom and meeting every visitor with the scary roar, with the lonely chicken walking on the floor, and with the baby-by in the closet, makes me laugh again. And I did not mention that one of the friends is missing his front tooth, another is wearing the hospital wrist band, and the groom has disappeared in the thin air. Did the tiger eat him or did he turn into the chicken or became a baby?  When Mike Tyson appears in the middle of the film as a visitor of three friends who were desperately looking for their friend and tried to figure out what exactly did happen last night, I knew that I liked the movie. Tyson singing in unison with Phil Collins and demanding that his pet-tiger who was stolen from his mansion must be delivered back to him or else, was a stroke of genius. Don Luis Bunuel would have loved that scene, I am sure.

We were watching uncut full version. Many of the jokes were far below the waist but the performers seem amused at what they were doing on the screen, and when this happens, then the audience laugh. Not for sensitive viewers, who easily blush and get insulted.

The Hangover may be described in two sentences,  what happens in Vegas, stays in Vegas and with the opening line from Mr. Doolittlle song in My Fair Lady,"Just get me to the church in time". We all have seen many movies about bachelor parties, Vegas, hangover, and male bonding. Hangover does not tell anything new but thanks to the clever writing and the real chemistry among Bradley Cooper (Phil, the schoolteacher), Ed Helms (Stu, the dentist), and Zach Galiifanakis (nerdy, socially akward brother-in-low to be homage to the Rainman), the film keeps the viewers interest and provides more than few laughs. Did I  mention Mike Tyson who almost overplayed the professional actors?

3.5 of 5

I watched this film after I had heard good reviews. The best that can be said about this film is that the concept was well thought out, and actually made me want to continue watching the movie just to find out what really happened to them (the damage after they woke up was just amazing).

Having said that...

Most of the time, it wasn't funny at all. In fact, I found the characters to be horribly immature even prior to the "accidental ingestion" (I'm not going to give too much here). I did not find the weird guy funny. All he apparently seemed to know how to do is walk around in weird clothing, or no clothing at all, and peeing all over the place. As for Bradley Cooper's character? An a-hole - stealing money from his students, calling his friend a "f******", wanting to leave a baby behind, and just being an overall moron.

Honestly, this movie made it big because apparently a lot of high schoolers, and overgrown boys decided to watch it. The supposed "funny" scenes mostly involved some sort of nudity, peeing, or pain reminiscent of the three stooges. I have to give this one two stars for an otherwise brilliant concept, but failing miserably where it counts.

If you are in the right mood and frame of mind for mindless fart joke-type humor then you will probably laugh hysterically for most of this movie. Most people did.

There are a few scenes that a large number of people agreed were shocking, disturbing and EXTREMELY offensive so I'll warn you about them:

There is a scene involving a baby and masturbation that will make many parents very angry.

There is a scene involving a man being sexually tortured by a little girl with a Taser while a cop (the filmmaker himself) stands by telling her she did a good job because she shot him "right in the balls" with the Taser which fries his testicles with 50,000 volts. Anyone who knows anything about the Taser and how the police and others are actually using it will find this 'gag' way too realistic and cruel to be funny. This sexual torture by Taser is really happening in the United States, minus the little girl, and it isn't a joke. But it is making a lot of lawyers rich while sending a lot of non-violent, unarmed men to the hospital with severe damage to their genitals for very little reason  (Google "Tavares Browning Taser" for a real life example. If you just want to see a video example of how the Taser shoots the testicles even when the police aren't trying to then Google "Taser balls Rescue Humor" and click the very first link "Police take a taser to balls")

You can also find the Taser torture scene on YouTube. If this scene doesn't bother you then you're pretty cold blooded, but the rest of the film will probably be fine with you.

Immediately after the girl sexually tortures one of the three friends' with the Taser, leaving him crying on the floor in castrated agony, a boy takes the Taser and shoots another of the three friends in the face with it. When the Taser victim doesn't fall down, the cop shocks him in the neck with a regular stun gun while making a casual remark, dropping him to the floor in a helpless heap of pain. Some people objected to this abuse, too, but since the police aren't actually shooting people in the face with Tasers it didn't receive as much criticism. Generally Taser shots to the face result in a lost eye, just as Taser shots to the genitals often result in destroyed genitals and severe emotional trauma.

If you can get past the baby masturbation scene and the Taser sexual torture scene then for the most part you can laugh your ass off at the rest of the movie. And if you are totally twisted then you may just laugh through those scenes, too.

This is not the Three Stooges. This is extremely harsh and cruel comedy. If you choose to watch it, brace yourself or drink heavily first or whatever it takes to loosen your mood, and don't let the kids see it. This should've been NC-17. The fact that it isn't is just further evidence of how useless and political the ratings review board is.

I love The Hangover. It's my favorite comedy of 2009, so I'm not going to give it anything less than 5 stars, but I just wanted to leave some words of warning to anyone who is interested in the "added value" of a digital copy. Beware that new Hangover blu-rays no longer come with a Digital Copy. I ordered my copy in January 2010 and when it showed up at my door, I discovered that it no longer contained a Digital Copy disc like I've seen in stores and even on Amazon when I initially ordered it. I think studios are gutting digital copies out of blu-rays shortly after they get a bill for all the iTunes downloads they aren't getting paid for.

I thought it was ridiculous when I read that every digital copy code has an expiration date less than a year after it's released. Sure enough I start looking at the fine print on all my blus with digital copies and they all have these expiration dates on them! So if you don't buy the blu-ray right when it comes out and use your code right away, the digital copy is worthless. I discovered this when I bought the Matrix box set a year after it had been out and couldn't access the digital copy because it was expired. Now it seems the new trend is to just take the digital copy out of the box just a few months after release, especially if it sells well, and hope no one notices. The "added value" of the digital copy is a sham.

I rented The Hangover on iTunes, thinking it might be pretty entertaining.  What a waste of $3.99; I'm only glad I had the good sense not to buy it.  It's the kind of humor designed to be a laff-riot for the lowest common denominator of movie viewers.  The Golden Globe awards committee must have been tripping on acid when they chose this piece of crap as best comedy.

We weren't sure how this movie was going to be, but all of our friends who've seen it were recommending it. On top of that, I was in Vegas for a bachelor party this summer when the movie was hot in the theaters. I have to say, we were laughing most of the movie. Very funny movie,  blu ray was packed with plenty of extra's.

The Hangover is funny but predictable and therefore is not a comedy classic (as so many fawningly throw out in their snippet reviews) unless your parameters are very narrow. The Hangover would easily offend a large majority of people (which I'm totally fine with, since the easily offended are often the biggest hypocrites) and it is as age intended as the Twilight series. Just as there are forty-something moms swooning over the teen romance in that mawkish series, there will be older guys guffawing and high-fiving their fave moments from this innocuous flick. But the target audiences for both are teens and twenty-somethings whose average cinematic experiences compel them to coin the utterly useless word "classic" and apply it to this movie. Compounding the problem is the excess hype that started nearly at the premiere. It just goes to show you how powerful media saturation can be.
In short, if you can imagine the highlights of the last five to ten years of movies from Will Ferrell, Seth Rogen, Judd Apatow, Ben Stiller, et al, you can pretty much predict where the laughs will come from.
Endorsing the Vegas theme to the extreme, The Hangover is all about a wild weekend with no consequences. Take from that what you wish.
Never recieved item and was promised a replacement item 10 days ago, but still haven't recieved it. I would rate the purchase as HORRIBLE!

This certainly isn't the comedy messiah and the savior of anarchistic comedy people claim it to be. What I found was, yes, a pretty formulaic (it's funny how people perceive the same film differently) and average (read: moronic) American comedy.

The premise for wackiness to ensue is a good one, but it has been done better in movies such as Very Bad Things (which, granted, is a different type of film).

In addition to a few funny lines and one-liners I felt the funniest (best) part was Galifianakis' Polaroid sequence - and that was during the end credits! Don't get me wrong, I enjoy a good modern comedy as anyone, such as Superbad - but a movie like Superbad has one crucial difference: a fantastic script. Despite the delicious premise, The Hangover only has a very average one and ultimately fails to deliver.

One special mention for the worst play-it-safe soundtrack in recent memory. Usher's "Yeah", "Who Let The Dogs Out"...seriously?

The Bottom Line:

Though I felt that the inclusion of the stereotypical Asian character was rather stupid and not very funny, on the whole The Hangover is a fresh, original comedy that doesn't follow any preordained path in giving the audience a lot of laughs (mainly from Zach Galifianakis, who single-handedly makes this movie) and lends itself to compulsive quoting and rewatching.

3/4

Certainly, there are some very funny characters and scenes in this film, but it feels like a patchwork of road trip movies you've seen before.  The movie succeeds in creating a silly comedy mystery of the absurd, and I admit I laughed often.  Too often, however, I could see the punch line from a mile away.  The movie is a series of neatly crafted punch lines without a compelling overriding comedy.  That is, every joke is the same or a more extreme variation on the same.  And so, the movie was more of an over-hyped letdown than a more genre-critical tour de force like Tropic Thunder.  I compare the two movies because they rely on the audience's previous knowledge of comedy film history, but Tropic Thunder succeeds in delivering actual Hollywood criticism where The Hangover manages the singular enticement of mere gross-out humor.  While I don't find the film to be a classic in any sense, I would still recommend it to anyone in need of a good laugh.

When i went to the theater with some friends to see this movie not really knowing anything about it, i didn't think it was gonna be good. I was grossly mistaken, this movie is hilarious from start tofinish.  i love zach gilifinakis in this i think he made this movie.  Its about 4 guys going to vegas for a bachelor party for one night but after a drugged shot of liquor.  They wake up the next day not remembering anything, but noticing all these weird things around them i.e. tiger in the bathroom, baby in the closet, chicken walking freely around.  So the whole movie they are trying to find clues as to what happened the night b4, and they meet a bunch of crazy people along the way that help them remember.  This movie is comedy gold.  I haven't met a person yet who said they didn't think this was hilarious.  A must see for anyone who likes funny movies.

Synopsis: The sensible Doug (Justin Bartha) is taken to Las Vegas for his bachelor party by his friends: the rude-and-crude Phil (Bradley Cooper), the overly p-whipped Stu (Ed Helms), and his soon-to-be brother-in-law and completed space cadet Alan (Zach Galifianakis). After they go to Vegas and have a toast to a night that they'll never forget, Phil, Stu, and Alan wake up the next morning without Doug and completely unaware of what it is they did the night before. The three men put together their exploits which saw them cross paths with an escort/stripper with a heart of gold (Heather Graham), a crazy yet effeminate mobster (Ken Jeong), and even Mike Tyson (himself) in a night full of improbabilities. Will the men be able to find their missing friend Doug? Will Doug make it back in town for his wedding? And will the guys eventually figure out everything that happened the night before? I thought this film was one of the best comedies I've seen in a while. Judging by the amount of negative reviews, I will be inclined to acknowledge that this movie is definitely not suitable for minors (largely due to the image of a street hooker performing unsimulated fellatio on a prosthetic penis worn by Galifianakis) or for people who are very sensitive to the gross-out humor found in the film (though I don't think a film would be allowed to be released if the "baby masturbation" joke would have constituted sexual abuse.) Make no mistake though, anyone who's afforded the opportunity to go to Vegas or even much less have had one of "those" nights that they couldn't remember will find an abundance of entertainment through out the film. In the end, it was the cast and the director that did it for me. I wouldn't consider any of the lead actors to be big-money players (though this movie unquestionably raised Galifianakis's stock). Yet since they had different elements of comedy that they brought to the screen, the chemistry was undeniably strong and made the film that much more believable. Director Todd Phillips has honed his craft for comedy with other films such as Old School and Starsky & Hutch but was able to execute a movie that received critical acclaim without having to have a whole lot of star power up front. I think this was, by far, his best effort and I have to applaud him for that. I recommend this film for anyone old enough to watch it but not for those who are a bit more prudent with their sense of humor.

Not a bad movie, but not nearly as funny as the premise. The opening scene sets us up for a very funny, and somewhat ominous, excursion, but the funny is too tame and the ominous is nearly nonexistant. I didn't want this to go as far into dark territory as "Very Bad Things" by any means ("Very Bad Things" was a superior movie in every way, but one is plenty), but it could have used a lot more edge.
I will give them credit for not making the second half into a chick flick, like "Wedding Crashers", "I Love You, Man", and most other guy films made these days.  If I wanted to watch a chick flick, I'd watch some pieces of crap with Amy Adams or Jennifer Anniston in it. Never resorting to the maudlin bull**** so commonly used to appeal to the female demographic is commendable, but "The Hangover" is still too watered down.

An okay movie. I think this director's best movie will always be Old School with Will Farrell, Luke Wilson and Vince Vaughn. A few funny moments here and there. I've only seen the rated version so I can't say the same for the unrated.

I don't know if I want to say that the extra pictures from the missing camera is worth the extra money spent, there are some photos during credits. BUT...I will say the movie is something I will watch several times. As for comedy movies, yeah, it's one worth buying if you like to giggle and chuckle...

I picked this up on disc because I had encountered various mentions online of people finding it hilarious, and I dote on comedy.  This one is slickly produced though sickly written from an unswervingly adolescent point of view.  Comedy works best when one or more of the characters is sympathetic: we laugh at the terrible difficulties this character gets into while hoping for him to triumph over them in the end.

I was able to generate no such hope for these four guys.  My sympathies were more engaged by the Las Vegas people, seen and unseen, whose job it was to clean up after these slobs.  Personally, I thought the stripper that the dentist married a far more suitable mate than the fiancee with whom he had already built a wretchedly dysfunctional relationship.  So, while the quartet does indeed get into terrible difficulties, my greatest hope was for them to wend their way toward a Darwin Award.

At what point do we say enough. I had the misfortune of seeing the movie on my honeymoon last summer. Some of it is funny, but when I saw the one adult male forcing a baby's hand to move around the baby's private area as if the baby was masterbating, I just wanted to leave the theater.

Who in the world was protecting this child from being exploited in the name of a movie maker making some bucks?

There are so many good movies out there of all ratings,  this just isn't one of them.

My family and I first saw it in the theatre. We laughed from beginning to end as did everyone in the theatre. I personally bought 5 copies of the DVD for everyone I could for Christmas so if they did not get their own I made sure they could see it. It was well done considering the sceniero it was not a just the same as all the other movies. It had a plot, action, continuous comedy and a happy ending. I love it and over Christmas I must have seen it six times with different groups of people and laughed every time. It just didn't get old.The Hangover (R-Rated Single-Disc Edition)

I'm not sure how a couple of scenes in this flick made it past the sensors . . . even I thought a couple of the sex scenes were off colour and of bad taste (without a X rating).

However, even the stuff in bad taste followed plot, IMO, and the script was funny with passable performances by the cast. The script was also original although I thought that it may be a bad remake of "Bad Things," which it turned out not to be.

Overall, I would recommend this to most anyone . . . except, and this is a big exception, for those who would object to extremely off colour and potentially offensive sexual content. The language is actually not that bad . . . although there is a fair amount of four letter words . . . but nothing close to some of the gratuitous cursing in some films.

Have fun.

Very nicely suprised by this movie, which I expected to be a male, lewd ,dumb, unoriginal movie...so totally wrong was I! We even watched it 2 nights in a row--something we never do. Laughed as much and outloud the second time as the first. Man, it is just FUNNY! Watch it! Enjoy!

Great comedy! It is even funnier the second time around, knowing what is coming next, and you're already laughing in anticipation! I bought this for my husband after we saw it in theaters and it has become a quick favorite! It's adult humor and can be crude, so you can't be easily offended; they don't shy away from any topics in this one. This comedy was unpredictable and fun, and it's worth the extra few dollars to get the unrated version with the bonus features on the second disc. We hope you enjoy it as much as we do!

Movie was indeed very funny and great late night entertainment, not the type movie I would want my young teenager watching' but great to show at a party or with adult friends getting together. If you liked "Wedding Crashers", type comedy you will like this, but recognize that this comedy is a little more hard core late night in it's presentation. The movie centers around the theme of of waking up the next morning with a hangover so bad that you can not remember what you did last night then working back through clues to what really happened in the most bizzare night of your life.
This movie blew me away...it was fantastic! I will purchase this one for sure! Funny to the very end.  This is a must watch movie!

Almost puked laughing at the end. If you remember not recalling a night of partying, you 'll relive that recollection watching this movie :)
Hahahaahaaa Awesome!

i still remember seeing it in the movie theater and loving how over the top the director made it feel. In a way it makes you think , '' wow i do not want to have a hangover lie that.''

It  gave me a new respect to las vegas..

 I thought fear and loathing in las vegas was whack..

Alan reminded me of a person with Asberger's with his lac of social awkwardness.. but he's just Alan.

Ashley Olsen is blessed to have a wonderful man like Justin Bartha - the groom that was missing..

The Hangover is a great movie that has a nice story and is very funny. The only flaw is that this movie could be offensive to younger children and might seem too offensive for older folk. This should be definitely a rated R movie, so plan accordingly. If you have the money to buy this movie, you should definitely purchase.

I think this was one of the funniest, most refreshing movies I've seen in ages. And not only did it have some amazing stomach hurting as I'm laughing so hard scenes, but others were just "cool" ... with the camera work, affects, etc (the face off between Allen and the young blond kid for example) or when Stu first wakes up.

I'd say 95% of this movie had me laughing or very interested in the characters/plot, with 5% being average to watch.

Sure people are going to give it one star for "crudeness" or some Politically Correct warnings about how the movie goes too far, but its a movie, and I feel some people have to lighten up a little... the entire movie was really funny, and I laughed so hard and often that I don't remember a movie that I enjoyed watching as much.

But I'm from a line of movies like Kevin Smiths Clerks, Mallrats, and others like the Ref, Bad Santa, Napoleon Dynomite, etc and wasn't offended by any of those.

The only part I didn't like much was the photo of Mike Tyson with the young blonde girl in bed. Might be truth, but was a little wrong to see. (But that was at the end and didn't ruin the movie at all).

All I heard going into this movie was how HILARIOUS this movie was -- and to be fair, it really wasn't all that hilarious.  It was a completely average movie.  Maybe I'm saying that because of all the hype I'd heard beforehand, but I've seen it twice... both times, leaving me completely baffled as to how this is an "all time classic" as some people say.

I thought the casting could have been better, but I suppose the idea was to cast 'normal' looking actors, rather than putting a few stars in there.  I get that, but the majority of the cast didn't have much input to the movie.  Bradley Cooper, of course, is rapidly gaining drawing power as an Actor, and he was excellent in the movie.

All in all, 2.5 stars out of 5, and if I'm pushing it, I might give it 3 out of 5.  Decent movie--I can't say it's horrible or bad by any means, but in all honestly, it's just not as good as all of the hype would indicate.

My husband said this movie was like Porky's...wrong.  It's funny without being offensive every few minutes.  The characters, for the most part, even though they do some very irresponsible things, are TRYING to be responsible.
Mike Tyson gives a pretty funny appearance, and the end ties up very neatly.

I cried laughing so hard! I couldn't believe how funny this movie was. I was wonderfully surprise. The movie began hilarious and didn't stop until the very end. Yes there was some shocking moments, but I think that was the idea. Will be buying this movie and recommending it to everyone.

The Hangover entered my Blu-ray collection the first Tuesday it was released (usually I wait a couple of months before buying a new release).  Unlike most movies in the past year, not all the funny situations or conversations was shown in the trailers.  The Hangover is hilarious, (i promise no spoilers) with a great plot and quotes.  The movie begins at the end and then proceeds to the beginning where the audience embarks on a journey with the characters as they unraval their crazy adventure in Las Vegas.  "What Happens in Vegas stays in Vegas" is the best to describes this movie without giving it away.  The actors made a good combo, I believe that Zach Galifianakis's character 'Alan' who isn't exactly the brightess and a bit on the crazy side really makes the movie with his off the wall comments and actions.  The storyline itself is highly original and funny throughout the whole movie; some of the outcomes may even surprise the viewer.  Since purchasing the movie last week my fiance and I have sat down to watch it at least 3 times (once by ourselves and the other two with various friends) and I still haven't grown tired of the movie.  Everytime I watch it I notice something else that was previously missed.

Fantastic performances from a largely unknown cast. I'm probably the last person in North America to watch this movie, and I could kick myself for waiting so long. Since a proper review would spoil many of the surprises, I'll just tell you to see for yourself. Also, if you're looking another great movie featuring an unknown cast, check out "L.A. Proper" on Amazon Video on Demand. "L.A. Proper" is a comedy about a multi-ethnic group of friends looking for love, sex, work and happiness during the long days and short nights of Los Angeles.

I usually take my kids' movie recommendations with a jaundiced eye; after all, they're teens/early 20s and American Pie isn't my idea of a comedy, neither is Adam Sandler.  So I was very surprised and entertained by this very funny film.  We watched it together on New Years Day and I've since watched it again with the special features.  You actually care about these poor guys after awhile but their wild ride shouldn't be missed.  I will probably end up buying this because I actually want to see it again - unlike too many "comedies" today.
This movie is worth getting, it is flat out hilarious. One of the funniest movies I've seen this year. I couldn't stop laughing the whole time.

This movie is hilarious and the it's the kind of comedy that you can watch over and over. It's well cast and well executed. Zach Galifiakanis, plays the creepy yest lovable loner and steals pretty much every scene. For those that haven't seen this movie, it's easily the funniest movie  of 2009 and probably IMO the best movie that was released this year. Its comedy and plot are sometimes a little over the top and ridiculous, but the movie's fast pace and continuous laughs, makes it easy to overlook that. The raunchy and sometimes juvenile humor won't appeal to everyone, but frankly if you don't find at least some parts of this movie amusing there is probably something wrong with you.
For the minute 1% percent of you reading this review that haven't seen the movie, the overall plot centers around 4 guys that go to vegas to celebrate a bachelor party. After a wild night none of them can remember what happened and one of them is missing. The remaining 3 spend the movie searching for their friend and filling in the gaps of the forgotten night. This one of the those rare movies that is just an instant classic.

The hangover went from being another R-Rated Comedy, to one of the highest grossing movies of the year, finding all sorts of praise and hype to go with it.  Sadly, when an underdog goes from word of mouth hit to hype machine, there's a potential for disappointment.  Luckily, even with the hype I was very happy with the hangover.  I'd like to go through a retelling of the funniest parts in providing this review, but I don't want to ruin anything for those who haven't seen it. Rather, I will say that this comedy's humor revolves around the crazy, and unpredictable antics of three buddies who awake after a night of partying, unable to recall the night before.  Simply finding out what happened would be funny enough, but the fact that one of their friends is missing, and their sleuthing to retrace their night, adds an extra level of fun, in trying to solve the mystery with them.

Getting past the hype, the critics, the box office, the hangover is a very funny, and very clever movie, that will entertain you.  While it happens to be an R-Rated comedy, they do not go out of their way to use the rating as an excuse for gross gags (though there are a few).  Rather, the Hangover relies on surprise, clever jokes, and likeable characters to make a very good movie that I highly recomend.

This movie is the  "comical" equivalent of another "Vegas" movie: "Very Bad Things". Anyone who watched that movie, and felt creepy afterward will understand the similarity. Yes, I laughed, very heartily at times, and yet I found myself ashamed at the same time. I suppose we're supposed to feel okay at the behavior of these guys because after all, they were drugged with a so-called date-rape drug, but for any film to really work,(at least for me) some of the characters need to be sympathetic. With the possible exception of Doug (Justin Bartha), who appears sparingly in the movie, these guys aren't. Now, with a movie titled "The Hangover", I knew not to expect Shakespeare, or even Abbott and Costello, but with so many patently offensive attempts at humor- a "masturbating" baby, and quite realistic-appearing fellatio during the end credits, I... well, you have to draw the line somewhere, and this movie crossed it.

If your humor is a little on the twisted side (you know who you are), you might like this.  There are quite a few unexpected funny scenes to keep you on the edge pretty much throughout.  It turns a little formula at the end but the "day after" scene is something out of someone's imagination who's really, really strange.  If a movie can make me laugh, that's saying something.

I didn't know if I'd like this kind of movie or not. Is it a typical comedy? Was it dark humor? What kind of movie is this anyway? Some kind of multiple bromance thing?

Well, it turns out it was a great romp. Basically what you have here is the quintessential surreal Vegas bachelor party adventure tale. And what a tale they tell. The premise of having these guys wake up after a night in Vegas with all sorts of strange repercussions, no memory of the events, and a missing key member of their group... it was a brilliant way to tell the story - much more so than if they had simply shown the events straight up. Unravelling the mystery is a blast, as they uncover one crazy stunt after another from the night before, and even continue on with some of them while they try to find their missing buddy.

The film sustains the momentum throughout the movie and ends with a blast with the credits. It's hard to precisely rate a movie like this, but it was a lot of fun and basically defines what people will think about when it comes to Vegas and bachelor parties for the foreseeable future. Fun movie.

One of the guys calls the bride to be and says "We messed up." He actually says something else, but similar. This was the funniest line in the movie to me because it is something all guys who have partied hard before had said and meant. Dumb stuff happens when you drink, and this movie is all about these dumb and outrageous moments that you barely remember the next day. Since these guys were slipped some roofies, they actually have no recollection of what happens to them and spend all day trying to piece the night together without getting killed.  Funny movie, though I heard it was even funnier than it was.

What a hoot!  "The Hangover" is a rollercoaster of fun.  Often unpredictable but always refreshing and off beat; this is a very funny film.

Four friends go to Vegas a few days before the impending marriage of one of them.  And they are four very different people: a school teacher, a nerdy dentist, a fat weirdo and the soon to be betrothed.  The night begins with drinks on the roof of "Caesar's Palace" where they hope for a night to remember.  Unfortunately, their drinks have been fixed with a date rape drug and, the next morning, they can remember nothing.  To make matters worse, one of them has gone missing and it's the one who's getting married in another day.  Their task is to reconstruct the events of the previous night and, in so doing, locate their friend.

What a night!  They have found a baby, stolen a tiger, one of them has been married and lost a tooth, visited a hospital and driven off with a police car; and they can't remember a thing.  The next day is also a barrel of fun.  They encounter hoodlums, they are blackmailed, tasered by the police and have an encounter with Mike Tyson.

I've probably said too much already.  However, I dare anyone to put these clues together without having seen the film.  Let's leave it at that.  See this film and laugh.
This movie was great to watch and funny. However there are a lot of adult situations in this movie. If you are looking for a family oriented movie this is not for you.

This film reminds me of "Dude, Where's my Car?" I won't compare but this film was funny. It was well done and it was exciting seeing how the events of the previous night unfolded. From the missing tooth, to the baby in the closet, to the tiger in the bathroom, it's one funny moment after another. Maybe it's true that the more you can't remember the more fun the night must have been.

I realize watching a movie about 4 grown men celebrating a bachelor party in vegas is not likely to be "thoughtful" in any respect.  But-- in fairness-- I watched this because my 40 year old bachelor brother brought it to our family Christmas get-together and since I generally feel sorry for him, I wanted to laugh with him and give it the benefit of the doubt.  But by the time they rolled the credits, I had to leave the room I was so angry.

1) Bradley Cooper: the best looking, well-dressed fellow, is "dying a little bit" every day of his married life.  The movie takes care to sort of pawn him off as a jerk (in order to not take moral responsibility for what they're doing), and yet somehow he's the most manly, keeping his cool, having the babin' wife (who, by the way, is amazed and full of gratitude at how her "husband is back" thanks to his wild times in Vegas!!!), and navigating the adventure.  And yet he's a complete misogynist. But apparently, entirely forgivable b/c at the end his kid is sleeping peacefully on his lap.  Hmmm...

2) The bride's father is the aged version of the aforementioned man, and tells his future son-in-law, "hey, what happens in vegas stays in vegas."  Boy, these "good fathers" who go to vegas for a little pick-me-up sure do love their daughters.  Oh yeah, I forgot: they're complete misogynists.  So I guess daughters don't really matter.  They're good dads to their sons, anyway.

3)  But apparently, the women who disagree with the idea of Vegas are abusive bitches who sleep with bartenders when they go on girl cruises.  Good wives forgive easily (like the bride) or are very sweet natured hookers.

4) And, just as it's always kind of in good fun to diss on women, it's also a good comedic turn to make every person of color or ethnicity totally foolish & dumb.  Naturally, the first picture to roll in the credits is of a large breasted naked black woman fooling around with the sick, strange, pedophile white guy who has no personal hygiene.  What should we assume?  She can't do better?  He's so weird he prefers black women?

Do you see my point?  Obviously this is frat guy fare.  But just as I felt in college as an (unlikely) sorority girl, I am again confirmed that all those people who really relished their greek system experience and continue to wish it into reality through movie experiences such as this are truly sick.  I know this movie and people who like it are just symptoms of a larger cultural problem, but it truly makes me sad to see how far we have to go.  And I am not surprised (but am saddened) that my brother is unmarried and virtually all of his friends who did get married have been divorced at least once.  If this movie represents some kind of personal fantasy for you, beware.

PS I agree that the photo roll at the end should have made this movie NC-17.
IF you don't know by now this is one of the BEST comedys ever made and will become a classic!

The best comparison would be between the "uncorked" version of Wedding Crashers (where all the added scenes really add something hilarious to the movie) and the "unrated" version of The Hangover (which doesn't really do much except add more time to the movie and adds very little that makes the movie any better).  I LOVE this movie, without a doubt!  I think it is the funniest thing to come out since Wedding Crashers or Todd Phillips' other great movie, Old School!  The unrated version just really isn't all that great of an addition and not really worth any extra cost for it.

The extra pictures from the camera are somewhat funny but don't really add that much either.  In my opinion you are just as well off with the theatrical version, which I watch all too often!  The "funniest" thing about the unrated version is that it doesn't add anything "unrated" to the movie!  Neither do the pictures!

I bought the unrated version the day it came out with high hopes of something even better but I guess when the movie that was seen in the theaters is really that good, you can't do much to improve it!

This movie is FUNNY.  Laughed so hard my wife came into the room to see if I was OK.  Actually had tears coming down, couldn't talk.
If you liked The Big Lebowski, you will love this.
Not for everyone, but this is one funny movie.
Watach it.

This movie is truly a humorous film. After watching it I decided I wanted to purchase it and I got tied up reading what the "bad" or "1 star", reviews were. There were two types of negative reviews. The first were upset that it wasn't funny. Those must be the people that own the box set of Extreme Home Makeover. The others were up in arms because of the mocked infant masturbation scene. Quite frankly it was crude, but if you seriously don't know that a move title "The Hangover" is going to involve crude humor than I think serious analysis of someone intelligence is in store.

Overall, the movie was excellently funny and a great exaggeration of plausible events that tie together to make for some hysterical moments. Just realize before hand that the film isn't a British comedy before viewing it.

What a waist of time.  I  can not reemember the last time I saw a film with no redeeming graces.  Like Mike Tysen himself (in this film)it has no finesse and bludgeons the viewer with attempts at sight  humor. Don't expect memorable one liners either.  In the end you will feel like your ear has been chewed on and wonder, what you are doing in the same building with this film.

5 of 5 stars for the comedy The Hangover. Let's see, take four guys (one to get married in two days), add Las Vegas, some drugs, shake well and you end-up the next day in a hotel suite with strippers, a tiger, a trashed room, a missing mattress, a missing front tooth, a live chicken and a missing bride groom. What's the problem? Noone remembers what happened--nothing, nada, zip. This movie is about the quest to learn what happened last night--and to find Douggie (the bride groom). The three remaining guys set-out to unwind the nights events, including a trip to a wedding chapel, discovery of a new wife (former stripper) for one of the three guys and a visit to the home of Mike Tyson (the boxer). This is a very funny movie with extreme moments and odd ball surprises. Two buckets of nuked popcorn are a must for this funny movie! Well made, extremely well written (who thinks of this stuff??) and really fun to watch. OK, a spoiler (not): Where did the live chicken in the hotel room come from??? They never explained that one. I highly recommend this movie; however, it is for mature audiences, lots of adult stuff. Oh, the infant found in their hotel room was a professionally trained stunt baby, so noone was hurt.

I found this movie to be anything but funny. I cannot understand how anyone could give this a good rating.
I was particulary upset with the scene with the baby masterbating. Where the heck was anyone's brain when this movie was shot?

I just rented and watched this tonight... well, tried to watch it.

I could barely get through the first 20 minutes of the movie.  ALL the characters are unsympathetic.  I could not care less about what happens to them.

It's a sad day in this country that this is what passes for humor.
It's worth the money you will laugh and ask what in the heck ...

This movie is the ultimate comedy for people who aren't whiny about raunchy things.  The characters are all great and work together extremely well.  Zach Galifianakis is, in particular, hilarious.  I've watched this movie twice so far (once in theaters and once at home) and both times my jaw hurt at the end from laughing so hard.  It was non-stop great scenes, funnier than old school, funnier than wedding crashers.  Chances are, if you are looking at this review, you've heard about this movie from friends/family, the good things that you've heard are true.  I'd recommend it for all adults, not just young.  I'm in my twenties but convinced my parents to see it and they were very pleased (again, though, not for those with issues about raunchy things and talk).  Get it and enjoy.

Whoever wrote this movie is very, very scary.
We laughed through the entire movie!

Just watched this on DVD, and while I laughed several times, I felt that I've seen most of this material before. Take equal parts "Go" and "Dude, Where's My Car," throw in a dash of "Sideways," and you've got "The Hangover."  It's certainly funny in spots, but there's too much violence for a comedy in my opinion; watching people get badly beaten, tasered, etc. is not my idea of humor.

I would take the middle ground of most reviews on Amazon, and tell you straight up that most of the funny parts are in the previews. There are still some twists and turns and jokes that will make you laugh but overall it's nothing special.

There is a place in movie life for R-rated comedies and "The Hangover" is a perfect example. It is silly, sick, and over-the-top and I laughed all the way through it. Now I have it on Blue Ray and it still makes me laugh every time I watch it again. On my personal "funniness scale" I rate "The Hangover" above "Wedding Crashers" and below "Tropic Thunder".

Just remember, this is a movie for grown-ups. It is R-rated for a reason. Don't kid yourselves about either of those two things and you'll have a great time with all the inappropriate silliness.

I tried making all the way through this movie but I kept getting too bored.  I finally gave up about 3/4 through it.  The pace is slow, the plot isn't as novel as it thinks it is, and the best gags are repeatedly shot dead by an annoying cast.

I was duped into purchasing this film because it was sold as "the funniest comedy of the year."  Since I was a fan of the American Pie & Knocked Up films, I figured this was more of the same.  Boy was I wrong.

PROs:
A few laughs (the taser scene comes to mind)
Solid direction & acting from the cast

CONs:
Crossing the lines of offensiveness (simulated maturbation of an infant for laughs by a character who is established as a sex offender--is one of the LEAST funny things a parent can think of.  This alone pretty much spoiled the rest of the film as a whole for me)
Full frontal male nudity
Embarassment of a naked elderly person for laughs
Unethical behavior without consequences
One of the actors receiving fellatio from an elderly woman in the closing credits

So much of ALL of the characters' integrity was tainted early on in the story, I had a hard time finding their antics actually humorous, but rather just stupid.  I would give this movie zero stars if possible.
Probably one of the funniest movies ever. My only issue is that the unrated version seemed identical to the theatrical. I wanted more jokes.

This is the kind of comedy where the actual laughs GROW on you very gradually.  You have to be a bit patient and wait for them, because let's be honest, the first 20 minutes of film are certainly nothing to brag about.  The juvenile humor that takes place in the very beginning of the movie is *extremely* misleading.

The main reason the Hangover is so good to me has MORE to do with the storyline than the style of humor.  Seriously!

The storyline is good- four... er, make that *three* young guys wake up one morning with a MAJOR hangover, and they have absolutely no idea what happened the night before.  All they have to go on as far as remembering what happened the night before are the things right in front of them, at the hotel room, such as a baby in the closet, a tiger in the bathroom, one of the guys having a missing tooth, and other things.

Without spoiling anything, these three guys go on an adventure of a lifetime as they retrace their steps through Las Vegas.

There's also a very dirty and disgusting kind of humor that manages to weave itself through the storyline, so I can only recommend this movie to people who are 16 years old or older.

Can we actually have some comedy films that actually possess some originality without the rehashed jokes, relentless advertising in every scene, and just poorly constructed and unlikeable characters.

I feel as though the trailer sufficed in portraying it's funniest parts because there was not much left after that; and even those selective scenes weren't that funny when I viewed them. My main problem with this film was not the stupid and repetitive humor but the uninteresting characters that we have to route for and hope they find their best friend Doug. Who cares about Doug or their journey to find out how he got kidnapped? The humor relies heavily upon random, bizarre, and illogical bursts of different characters, infliction of pain, random celebrity cameo's (Mike Tyson) and just bad dialogue. I usually don't mind this type of humor when it is executed properly and in a timely fashion.

This film, on the other hand, is just a poor excuse for another college humor comedy. The sad part is that these hero's were supposed to be routing for are like in their 30's with wives and kids, pathetic. Now we don't have to scratch our heads and realize why male adults act like their still in college and milk their party years till their 50. This film preys on an audience who is just out of touch with reality and cannot appreciate carefully constructed characters, witty and realistic dialogue and plausible friendships, because in this film these guys have anything but on-screen chemistry; it comes across as awkward and unnatural.
I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. This was very funny and I had some good laughs! Excellent movie....great comedy.

Apparently, though, a lot of other people do, because I have seen some truly caustic reviews of this movie.

So let me preface this (to ward off suggestions that I am a frat boy with a low IQ)with the following:

I'm female and have a doctorate.

This movie was freaking hilarious.  I laughed start to finish on this one.  It's Old School-scale hilarity.  It's crude, it's obnoxious, and it's not headed for the Oscars, it's just headed to a place on my admittedly small shelf of DVDs, to join my collection of go-to movies to smooth over a rough day at work.  It will get you out of your bad mood, that's for sure.

The actors had great chemistry, the scenes were outlandish (although looking back on it, their adventures, while outrageous, were actually fairly tame.  Want to see a Las Vegas bachelor party gone seriously awry?  Watch "Very Bad Things". And yeah, I liked that one, too.), and I laughed just as hard at my second viewing as I did my first.  And Heather Graham? Now there is an underappreciated actress. Why doesn't she get more roles? She was great as the good-hearted stripper.  Ken Jeong's first scene had me crying with laughter. That guy is funny in everything he is in.

Also, the scene with the baby that so many complained of? It's just a guy acting stupid with a fully clothed baby.  It reminded me of something my little brother and one of his nitwit friends might have done when I brought my infant son over.  Is he pretending to molest the baby? No.  Is he pretending the baby is molesting him? No. It's not child abuse, it's not sexual abuse, and to suggest it is demeans real victims of such abuse, so please get over yourself.

Caveat: My kid is 18, so I would let him watch this movie, but you probably don't want to watch it WITH your kids, regardless of their ages.  It might be a little awkward.

Seen the movie in the theater and loved it so much that i went ahead and purchased the movie. This movie makes you laugh almost all the way through the whole movie. Saw the preveiws and did not know what to think of the movie until i whent and seen it. Thought i was going to wast my money at the theater but it was well worth it. I have recomended this movie to my family and friends.

I loved this film and find it absolutely hilarious.  On that note, beware that there is crude humor include full frontal male nudity.  Not the kind of movie you want to watch with Grandma sitting next to you or your 8 year old kid.  For those who don't mind a bit of crude humor this is a great movie.  The absurdness of the movie and what the guys do just keep you laughing throughout the film.  Mike Tyson makes a great cameo in the film and makes it clear he is a man you don't want to screw with.

This is a great movie with friends.  We rarely buy films because once we've seen it once that's usually good enough but with the Hangover we were sure to go out and buy it. I'll admit it - I felt victim to hype when seeking out this movie.  I paid heed to all the positive reviews it got and trusted friends and family of mine that described it as "hilarious", one going so far as to say that he couldn't remember the last time he'd laughed that hard watching a movie.  Based on all this positive reception, I expected to be doubled over and trying to catch my breath while watching "The Hangover" but I found myself chuckling only moderately and feeling a little letdown once the end credits rolled.  The movie will tickle some funny bones more than others but on a personal laugh scale of 1 to 5, I only rate it a 3 and I have to assume it is because I am not a bachelorette, party girl or Vegas enthusiast, and I have no interest of ever visiting the place.

The movie centers around a young affianced guy named Doug (Bartha) and his three groomsmen that take a trip to Vegas for one wild night a few days before his impending nuptials.  Phil (Cooper), a married teacher with a son, Stu (Helms), a dentist, Alan (Galifianakis), Doug's dim-witted brother-in-law-to-be and the groom himself all book an expensive villa at Caesar's Palace and toast one another on the roof of the building before descending the stairs again for partying and debauchery.  When they wake up the next morning, the posh villa has been demolished - an armchair smolders in the main sitting area, food and drink are all over the place, a clucking chicken roams the halls and a tiger (yes, you read that right - a TIGER) has taken residence in the bathroom.  Waking up on the floor severely dazed and assessing the celebratory carnage around them, they notice Doug is missing from their small band and they immediately embark on a search for him, desperate to make it to LA for the wedding before it's too late.

The rest of the movie is a puckish step-by-step of how all the mayhem transpired.  Along with the mysteries of the animals roaming the villa are Stu's missing tooth, Phil's hospital bracelet, a mattress on the roof of Caesar's Palace and a stolen cop car, not to mention everyone's curious amnesia.  When a date rape drug called rohypnol (aka "roofies") is found to be the culprit for their short-term memory loss, they exhaust every little lead they can to locate Doug, becoming impromptu detectives in the process, and wind up in much bigger predicaments than they all thought possible.  The film depends on these outlandish quandaries for its laughs and pulls out all the stops for a zany Vegas adventure, some of which include a quickie marriage to a stripper, a run-in with "Iron Mike" Tyson and a hostage situation in the desert.  The script (derived from a real life Vegas bender) relies on moderate amounts of profanity, sexual humor, nudity (I personally could've done without seeing Galifianakis's hairy, cellulite-ridden posterior), drugs/alcohol and the general lore of Sin City for its laughs.  It certainly doesn't help that it comes from screenwriters who are fairly young in their careers.  The end result is that it doesn't break any new ground in the comedy genre, despite its critical and box office success (it's grossed more than $277 million in the US and Canada as of December 2009).

Helms (of "The Office" fame as Andy Bernard) plays the sensible guy of the bunch who acquiesces to his cold, stiff harpy of a girlfriend because he's too nice for his own good (you can hardly wait for her to get a comeuppance of some sort).  Cooper is the guy with a devil-may-care streak who is dissatisfied with the mediocrity of his life and Galifianakis is a big-hearted oddball who is just trying to belong.  Bartha doesn't get to stretch his legs much as Doug because of his absence from over half the film, his character just a conduit for the plot.  Heather Graham as a smokin' hot but kindly stripper named Jade comes off as a real sweetheart just looking for a connection with an honest man.

Bottom line: Despite becoming the eighth-highest grossing film of 2009 so far and snagging a Golden Globe nomination for Best Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy, I'm overall not impressed with "The Hangover" and am glad I did not buy it before watching it.  Though I wouldn't have regretted it deeply, it still would've stung to spend $15 on a film that failed to conjure the side-splitting laughs I was so readily expecting.

I read lots of ultra-hype about this movie before seeing it in the theater, which raised my expectations. I am guilty of reading what the critics print. It seems there must have been some kind of "love this movie, it's great" plague when reviewing this movie. On Rotten Tomatoes, it rated at around 90% positive, which is stellar on that site. Yes, my expectations were very high.
***SEMI-SPOILERS AHEAD, READ WITH CAUTION:***
I just felt that there were too many "mini-situations" thrown into the mix. Some worked and some did not. The police station incident seemed overly predictable, Jackass-like, and thrown in for filler.
Tigers are endangered, so I hate seeing real tigers used in movies. I could not find any humor in the use of the tiger for gags.
The baby! It's not funny to leave your baby with a group of total strangers who are drunk and drugged. He was found in the closet! I know it is only a movie, but I could not find that humorous.
I laughed in the theater and had fun, but at the same time I left thinking I had seen a comedy that "tried too hard with as many failures as successes" to get the laughs. I still recommend it as a rental. Do not buy until you rent first!
You just read my opinion of this film. I may be right, I may be wrong. Intelligent comments are very appreciated!

Let me first start by saying Zach Galifianakis is the best (and the only) funny thing about "The Hangover". He finally gets his due after years of underrated movies (i.e. "Out Cold"), hilarious online video skits (i.e. "Between Two Ferns"), and Comedy Central specials. If it wasn't for Zach G., I would have absolutely hated this movie and would have given it 1 star.

So why my utter disappointment in this movie? It's a tale of two halves. The first half is where Zach's tried and true character/persona of acting dumber than dirt, shines the most. Yes, he plays this same persona in his comedy act and any movie he's ever been in, but he absolutely kills it and is hilarious. It never gets old. The beginning part of the movie shows a lot of promise to be a comedy classic.

Unfortunately, after their infamous drink on the rooftop that transitions their saga to the next morning, the second half of the movie completely falls flat. I really can't remember laughing once. Tiger in the bathroom? Awkward Mike Tyson appearance? Clich Vegas wedding no one remembers? I understand they're going for cheap laughs with this uninspired circumstantial humor, but it just doesn't get the laughs from me. I'm all about stupid humor (like what Zach G., Will Ferrell, Jim Carrey, etc. are so famous for), however it must be witty. Any writer hack can throw in a random circumstance out of left field... it simply doesn't take any creativity.

So on to why this movie really falls flat. "The Hangover" plot comes straight from the script pages of "Dude Where's My Car". Shocked? Perplexed? In denial? Google the movie titles together and you'll see a College Humor video that does a quick side-by-side comparison of the two (I'd post a link myself but it would get deleted by Amazon). I understand this movie came out several years ago with comedy lightweights Ashton Kutcher and Seann William Scott. And I understand the humor is extremely sophomoric (which is also the case in The Hangover). I also understand that movies/books/comedians/artists steal material from each other all of the time. But the humor on "Dude Where's My Car" was better executed than in the 2nd half of "The Hangover" (which isn't saying much). It probably also helped that the prior film trail-blazed the concept/formula before the subsequent rip-off by "The Hangover", causing it to be really watered-down for me. If you or most other people would have seen "Dude" before they saw "Hangover", you'd have the same feeling of being cheated after all of the insane hype I had heard.

Given the choice, I'd have the first half of the "Hangover" and the second half of "Dude Where's My Car" meshed into one hilarious movie. I rate "Hangover" 2.5 stars. I can only rate whole stars, but I figure I'd go with the 2 since this movie is already overrated on Amazon. It's a tough thing to be a dissenter of such an over-hyped comedy movie (I'm prepared to get a lot of "Unhelpful" check marks on here from die-hards), but I want to let you know that I really tried to like this movie. This kind of movie is right in my wheelhouse. It just wasn't original enough or funny enough. Truth hurts.

I don't understand how Hollywood can legally make a movie that can be shown to children accompanied by an adult that contains sexually explicit images.  Don't people get arrested for doing stuff like this?  I know everyone will say it's on the parents to monitor what movies their children are watching, but what is the NC-17 rating for if not for this type of movie?

I read a review on Rotten Tomatoes that referred to the scene with the baby being used as part of a sexually explicit gag as "wildly inappropriate." Wildly inappropriate? I don't think that covers it. When did it become acceptable to use a baby in ANY kind of gag that is sexual at all? This went way beyond inappropriate. Children of any age ought to be beyond fair game for such things. Using a child in a sexually explicit manner is wrong whether it's in actuality or merely being suggested. You just don't use children in that way. It's a line we should not cross. This is the first movie I've run into that has such a scene in it, I hope it's not a trend. The fact that the individual using the child during this over-the-line gag had earlier in the movie been identified as a possible child predator only makes it all the more repugnant. Going in I expected frat-boy style gags. I expected swearing and vomiting and men behaving like boys. I never expected to see an adult male miming masturbation of a toddler with what appears to be the child's own hand. It was a bit shocking actually. This wasn't the funniest movie I've ever seen, not even close, but even if it were, the business with the baby alone was enough to make me dislike it. There's just no coming back from a transgression like that. This review is aimed at the unrated version of the film btw, I'm not sure this scene made it into the R version.

You have to see it!

I have wanted to see this film ever since I first saw the trailer many months ago. The film lives up to and beyond my expectations as it is not only funny, but avoids the obvious pitfalls of these buddy comedies with a fresh approach. The story of "the day after" is one that is easily identified with(well at least most guys will) and by having us come along for the ride to find out what the H E L L happened the night before, keeps the viewer completely focused as if we were part of that night. Even though the basic story has been done a million times, I can not remember when it has been done better. I watched the unrated version first and I will compare the two versions soon. The Blu Ray looks great and has a nice assortment of extras, including 100 pictures from the night before that are almost as funny as the film(just make sure you watch the film first). Other extras include a gag reel, making of, map of the night before and lots more. One of the most enjoyable comedies I've seen in the past few years.

I saw this movie at a theater in Myrtle Beach this past Fourth of July while on vacation with a very rowdy crew and after hearing all the talk my expectations were pretty high. When the movie was done and the credits where rolling I found myself disappointed because as the pictures from the lost night flashed on the screen I found myself really wishing that was the movie I had just seen. I know, I know, you're going to start hammering me with the negative check marks saying this review wasn't helpful. But before you do that KNOW that I really wanted to love this movie, so much so that I bought the blu-ray of this movie to give it another chance. I had my wife watch it with me this time and we laughed a lot and I liked it even better than before. However, as the credits rolled the same nagging issue hampered my totally loving this movie. The Rohypnol pictures seemed like the makings of a much funnier movie. I plan on watching this movie again, probably more than a few times, and maybe my opinion will change but for the moment it's a solid movie that didn't push it over the top. Just to give the reader a base, Animal House, There Something About Mary would be 5 stars. I recommend watching this adult comedy and found it very funny, just not 5 stars funny.
